38886210.review: Charming graphics with gameplay that focuses more on stealth than fighting.

38865307.review:
What a charming stealth-lite game. No hand-holding for exploration, but I wish you could make notes on the map yourself; I often found myself wondering where such-and-such door was when I got the key to it hours later.

When you complete 'costumes' (you are a minstrel after all) - you can wear them to get different dialogue with characters and that's a nice twist.

The game isn't violent and seems altogether to have nice manners; it's a pleasant change of pace in this day and age.

I wouldn't call it an action game - it seems more about exploration, sneaking around, and figuring stuff out.

...also it is very cute.

38813163.review:
Ayant plutôt tendance à regarder les commentaires négatifs quand il y en a beaucoup de positifs, ce coup-ci je serai du coté un peu moins regardé.

Mais bon sang que ce jeu s'annonce bien !
Des graphismes vraiment impressionnants, une végétation foisonnante, et avec une configuration pas forcément extrêmement puissante, il tourne honorablement. Le plus notable est la régularité du framerate, il ne s'envole pas, mais ne tombe pas non plus, il reste constant tout le long, ce qui est vraiment appréciable quand on est vers la limite faible (30/35 FPS)

L'un des autres plus gros plus dans ce jeu, c'est la capacité de notre personnage à se déplacer. 
Il n'est pas frustrant ! Je m'explique : dans d'autres jeux avec un héro super efficace on peux grimper à des endroits complètement ahurissants, mais arrivés devant de petites corniches ou un mur pas prévu pour, le héro ne peux rien faire alors que juste avant on a gravis une montagne sans difficulté. Ca c'est frustrant ! 

Dans Ghost of a tale, notre personnage est limité en capacité à grimper, mais cette limite est partout la même, donc on connais la limite de celui-ci, mais elle s'applique partout aussi bien ! il est alors possible avec un peu d'ingéniosité de grimper partout. C'est une vrai libération pour le gameplay, un déplacement ultra fluide dans toutes les conditions. 
Une mécanique toute simple est aussi mise en place pour palier à sa petite taille. C'est juste excellent !

Pour ce qui est du moins ? Parfois le jeu demande un peu trop d'aller/retour, les rats qui ne sont pas vraiment forts, on les craint plus pour les dégats que pour la poursuite, ou d'autres fois, ils ne peuvent physiquement pas nous voir mais savent exactement ou nous sommes. Le game over vraiment volontaire, le défis par moments très léger.

Bref vous l'aurez compris j'ai vraiment apprécié ce jeu autant sur le fond (l'histoire , les quêtes annexes), que sur la forme (les graphismes ou son gameplay) "nuance faite de la grande facilité d'esquiver les rats," j'ai hate de voir l'histoire dans son ensemble à sa sortie officielle.

I felt entertained all the time, the lore of the world is nicely detailed, the NPCs are cunning (I love the pirate frog, he's my favourite) and the graphics are just stunningly beautiful. The only two nitpicks are the missing quest rewards (Why should I do a item collecting for nothing?) and the fact, that I could not open that one door. But these are just little nitpicks, all in all I reallly enjoyed the journey of the little mouse so far, and I am more than curious about what comes next. I recommend everyone to give this title a shot. I really feel like playing Cuphead back in the days at the convention, no one else knew about it, nobody played it there. When this is finished, it will be a modern classic, a lot of people will talk about. Thumbs up, great game!

38773889.review:
It really is a shame that I was unable to play this game, because from what I can see by the trailer and screenshots alone, Ghost of a Tale is truly gorgeous and unique in its own right.

I am in love with the concept of the game as well as with the nicely rendered medieval setting that you play in. The hiding mechanic for avoiding enemies is also a great touch to the game and contributes to its dangerous, ominous atmosphere. 

To my disdain, my old laptop was ultimately unable to run this game properly. The menu lagged, and I struggled to configure the settings, but more often than not, this ended in my screen freezing for a long time. When the game itself finally loaded, the application terminated due to incompatibility issues. Of course, this is not a problem with the game; it is a problem with my computer. Overall, I am highly disappointed that I was unable to play. I requested a refund to make up for this inconvenience.

So like I said, even though I did not have the luxury of experiencing the gameplay firsthand, I am intrigued by the concept and how imaginative the whole thing is.

9/10 is my rating for this game. If your operating system can handle this game, unlike my dinosaur of a laptop, I definitely recommend picking up this gem while it is still in Early Access!

38356010.review:
[b]Note; I’ve only played Ghost of a Tale for a few hours, which was enough to wet my appetite but not enough for this to count as a review. Instead, I've written down my initial impressions and you can see a more in depth first impressions in my video.[/b]
https://youtu.be/vcz88pc-WGE
So this is the game that 7 year old me dreamed of playing after devouring another book in Brian Jacques’ wonderful Redwall series. On seeing it pop up on Steam’s new releases last year it immediately reminded me of those books and I instantly added it to my wish list. 

Having now played the title it really did recapture the feeling of reading the books as the setting and characters are so similar to how I pictured Redwall and its inhabitants. Praise has to be given to the lone developer for creating a game that looks this gorgeous and for creating a cast of characters with so much personality. The titular hero of this tale is one of the most adorable and endearing video game characters I’ve experienced and he doesn’t even talk.

Speaking of talking I’d love to see some voice acting in the finished game but I understand that the budget might not allow for it. Audible emotes might be a good compromise as the enemies and npcs are all fairly silent (as a mouse). There also appears to be some problems with the ai which on one occasion made sneaking past a guard impossible and the stealth overall seemed a little unfair. I also ran into another bug which you can see in my video but overall the game ran pretty smoothly without too many hiccups. 

That’s quite some feat for a tiny indie studio especially when the game looks so lovely. I haven’t really talked about the gameplay much but it’s a semi open action adventure game with stealth elements and this is all elevated due to some wonderful attention to detail and creative design work. The story is interesting and there is lots of lore to sink your teeth into. Honestly, it was like discovering Redwall abbey once again. Combine this with Tooth and Tail and you’d probably have the ultimate Redwall video game. 

All that said I’m not going to continue playing the early access version as I don’t want to spoil the full release, which I’m greatly anticipating.

38160757.review:
I was looking for a stealth game which did not depend on killing everyone you see, but instead strongly advised against killing. Or as this title, forbidd you from killing. This is exactly what I wanted! Plus, being the cutes mouse this side of die-hard cuteness, is not bad either :P He is just SSSSOOOO CUTE!
Speacking of looks, this game is dashing! The textures and level of detail and care put into this game is a recordbreaker in my book (maybe after Star Citizen, but I dont compare). Seith and his gang sure put some serious years into this game!
Down to mechanics, the sneak and hide mechanics are very polished and well done. Yes, we have a early access to work with as of writing, but I still like it. The AI though, the aggro-meter is VERY usefull, but the guards can seem a little not-all-there in the head when you hide in a chest in a room where there only is ONE CHEST. But I guess we cant ask they be human. Ohh wait, they're rats! Also, I easily dodged a whole hep of them in the cortyard, just running by their skins. Reactiontimes like mollassess. But they will quite easily overpower ya. Could use some more strategy for their AI though.

But the conclusion, GoaT is a GREAT game!
Graphics 10/10
Gameplay 9/10
Mechanics 9/10
AI 6/10 (give em more teamwork, example NFS Payback, the cops try to pin you in, and if you escape, you get beat up like a fish in a tiny barrel!)
Recommended to all who likes a cute, non-violent stealth game with AAA graphics.

38041524.review:
So far, this game has everything I like about a game. It doesn't punish you, stunning graphics, tons of areas to explore and lots of things in the game world to find. Somewhat linear, but has bit of a sandbox feel to it. You can choose to follow the path, or go left, right, or even back to explore areas you couldn't previously unlock if you want to, but all paths do require doubling back to the path. Not a lot of 'combat' in this game. You can hit enemies with bottles to knock them out and that's about it from what I've seen so far--but then, I really like to explore every nook and cranny of an exploration game, so I may just not have progressed far enough yet.

The biggest con is that the game does have weird bugs when adjusting graphic size, and sometimes when it launches or you tab out of it, it'll launch only the window, but not the contents and make it kind of a pain to exit out without navigating with your keyboard. But it's still in development, so I'm sure it'll only keep getting better.

37451917.review: Where to start with this game. I bought this on Humble Bundle when I saw it was on sale for slightly cheaper than sticker price, so I decided to pick it up. The main thing that pulled me in were the graphics and the adorable character design. So, as this is an early access game, I was well surprised at the quality of the animations of the main character. When walking, sneaking, sprinting, jumping, or falling everthing was extremely smooth as if it has a proper weight to it. The gameplay is fun as a stealth game, it accomplishes the stealth well with several tools/places to hide which can give you the flexibility to play how you want. The quests amount to collectathons, this is fine as you can accomplish these as you move along the main story. This segways into the next point, the story, it's good and is relatively intriguing and makes you concerned for Tilo and his family. My only gripe with the game is probably the lack of voice acting, this is probably an intentional design choice and either way I am fine with or without it as it does not detract from the story or gameplay. Overall, I am satisfied with this early access purchase and look forward to what the full release may bring.

37267231.review:
To start off, I'm not normally one to leave reviews, but I decided to push myself into writing this one because I feel this game needs a couple more reviews. So in hope of adding in a new unique perspective to this game, I shall begin. 

Let me simply TL;DR my main points right now:
Although the game, mechanically, isn't very groundbreaking or really even interesting in it's stealth/hiding gameplay, the setting, characters, themes, visuals, and plot of it (from what I've seen so far) all together easily tips the balance into a positive experience. 
And simply put, if ya like mice/rats, you'll love this. 

So with the gameplay, from what I can tell not much of it is really unique. The whole stealth mechanics work pretty much exactly as you'd expect them to. If you're looking for some kind of stealth/sneaking oriented game with a unique twist or catch or something like that, this probably won't do it for you. That all being said though, even though it's not anything [i]new,[/i] it is all very well crafted. Nothing really feels broken or twitchy, play it the way you should and it'll work the way it should. 

Now as for pretty much every other aspect of the game, well to start off it just [i]looks[/i] very beautiful. The lighting is rather well done, the enviroments are designed very well and appropriately, and the characters, guards and Tilo himself all have wonderful models. It all looks so good in fact that you might wanna double check your specs if you're hoping to play at a decent setting and/or framerate. My GPU isn't all that spectacular so I need to downgrade the visuals a little and still get some frame drops in certain instances, but none of that stops me from appreciating it.

There are only a handfull of characters you get to talk to at first but each has a use in one way or another, either tying into quests later on or giving vague tips to help you find things. They all also have wonderful writing, giving them all great personalities which makes them fun to talk to and read out the whole conversations, which never tend to drag on for very long anyways. And along with the writing is also the world setting, which is all quite unique and interesting to read up on the tidbits of information you can find about the backstories of certain things or places, and sidenotes inserted through dialogue even help explain what certain words mean in this world. 

To cut myself off from getting to rambly I will conclude with this; 
I would recommend buying this if you plan on playing it in large chunks, instead of putting it down and picking it up on and off, because that might wear off its charm more quickly. 
Let yourself be charmed by it, and you won't be disappointed with the experience.

36771915.review:
Erken erişimde olmasına rağmen hem grafikleri hem de hikâyesiyle beni benden aldı. Tilo adında, ozanlık yapan bir fareyi yönetiyoruz oyunda. Boncuk boncuk gözleri, sırtına astığı minik lavtası, dört ayak üstünde koşuşu, arada poposunu kaşıması ve tüyleri... o kadar... o kadar... ŞİRİN ki tutup mıncıklayasınız, sıkıca sarılasınız geliyor hayvana. Bağımsız bir oyundan beklenmeyecek kadar muazzam bir görselliği var oyunun.

Sıçanların gardiyanlık ettiği bir zindana atılan bahtsız faremiz buradan kaçmaya ve kayıp karısını bulmaya çalışıyor oyunda. Küçücük bir fare olduğumuz için savaşmamız mümkün değil. O nedenle parmaklarımızın ucuna basa basa ilerliyor, sandıklara ve dolaplara saklanıyoruz. Bu esnada da bir sürü irili ufaklı bulmaca çözüyoruz. 35935185.review:
Positives:
Just going to start by saying, The most immersive game I have played in a long time. 
Definitely became one of my top 5 favorite games ever... shortly after playing it.  
-Environment, graphics, lighting, and framerate are amazing.
-Feels like a AAA game while playing.
-Rich ambience, and story. 
-Extra readable and hidden lore that you will actually want to read. (IMO)
The ability to jump and climb make the game feel super "open world".
-No, or very few, Invisible walls. 
The game lets you go where you want, by funneling the story through a series of locked doors or blocked areas that you must either find keys for, or solve puzzles to unlock.
 

Opinions:
The story resembles "The Secret of Nimh"  and shared similarities in level design with games like The Witcher 2 and Fable. 
If you think this game looks good, and you are into Stealth or Rpg games, have a good imagination, or are suceptible to immersion then this is a must buy.

Negatives:
-Once in a while bugs, like getting wall stuck, or audio muting were easily fixed by reloading or restarting game.
-Entire game is not out yet and will leave you attached to the world just as it ends.

Overall:
The game is a 9/10 if you are in the mood for an Immersive, Stealth, RPG.

35722863.review:
So far this year, there has been a very small motley collection of games that have succeeded in absolutely mesmerising me by drawing me into their respective animated worlds full of charm, ambience, atmospehere, and otherworldy sensations - Ghost of a Tale is one of those games. To enjoy this masterpiece in all its splendour, leave your judgemental adult self at the door, let your inner child run rampant, and allow yourself to be engrossed and captivated in a Beatrix-Potter-esque world of yesteryear.

I played the game using a mouse, and being born in the year of the rat, it was obviously a recipe for success ! 

There are some unfavourable reviews abounding regarding the alleged short play time - I acquired Ghost of a Tale late September (with the latest EA patch) and managed to get over 9 hours of playtime from the current content (and still didn't complete all 33 available quests). According to the Developer, this current content constitutes approximately 50%-60% of the full game, but given the absolute charm that the game exudes, it's already well worth the price of admission - value is purely subjective !

For all those who are still a "child at heart", this is not to be missed ! 

Highly recommended and extremely commendable given that the dev team is essentially one individual, albeit an individual with an impressive resume !

34862491.review:
Ghost of a tale is a fun to play and a really gorgeous looking game. Stealth mechanics work great, but if you just want to quickly backtrack from point A to point B the game won't punish you too hard for alerting one or multiple guards to your presence, as you can easily find a hiding place to wait them out. Yes, there is some backtracking, but is made far less irritating than in most titles through game's single, continuous environment and multiple paths you can take from one location to another. Speaking of that environment, it feels truly filled, lush, alive and immersive. Being underground feels like you really are underground and in contrast forest really looks and feels like a forest, which is something I find a lot of game struggle with and tend to feel unfinished. Ghost of a Tale actually IS unfinished, but it already feels incredibly rich.

Gameplay is very straight-forward for a stealth game. You can sneak, hide, knock your opponents out or distract them. All of these work well, are fun to do and I've not run into any issues with them during my playthrough. Minor bugs aside, I've not ran into anything game-breaking or quest-breaking, or really any kind of bug or glitch that interferred with my gameplay. If these were present in earlier versions, they have been fixed.

The main character, Tilo, is quite compelling with his adorable appearance, poignant backstory and clear motivations. You are also given some, admittedly very limited, choice with his personality when picking dialogue options during NPC conversations.

Although the story has been described by the developer as linear, there are a few choices to make during the game, most of which unfortunately we do not yet get to see the result of (like what you decided to do with the spyglass). Some quests also give you multiple options on how to complete them and some quests are not all that easily discovered, thus giving you a reason to thoroughly explore this wonderfully crafted world. Expositional text is simple and yet effective in conveying the world of the game to the player. It is sometimes serious and sad, and other times funny, even occasionally dipping into black comedy. Besides telling you about the world, it might also reveal things about Tilo and other NPCs.

On the more biased note; this game will most definitely appeal to the fans of Redwall, Mouse Guard, Beyond the Western Deep and similar works. I thoroughly recommend Ghost of a Tale to those whose stylistic predilections are already aligned with the game, those who enjoy stelath games and those who just enjoy a colorful and well defined fantasy worlds. It’s already worth your time and money in its early access state.

34593671.review:
I'll try to be clear; nevertheless, english is not my native language. I hope that does not become an issue in my review. 

The game, so far (nearly six hours played) is one of the most charming and fun games I've ever played. IT IS NOT a small game. Takes hours to solve some quests, lot's of dialogues -all of them very good written, by the way- and not just a bit of persistence. I don't think I expected that much of this game, but it is one of the greatest promises of the game-world this days. If they don't make it a small game, as it shouldn't be, and make use of the potential of this game to became a medium or large game experience, I do not doubt it'll become so good as the biggest names of the RPG catalogue.

To talk about the developing situation, I must say game is enjoyable so far. I've played quite a long time now and I'm not done with it. There are, nevertheless, some things I'd say could be better. The greatest one is difficulty. I think the trick and joy of the game is in exploring, stealth and solving puzzles. That's an undeniable truth, and difficulty is fine BY ME. But I don't ignore that there could be some players that expect quite more of a challenge, regarding the enemys, I mean. It comes a point where it's just running, knowing that none of them will be able to catch you. I'd put a mark on this point.

Graphics are just fine; beautiful designs on every place of the game, also. Sometimes the change that is produced on the brightness of the screen when passing from a dark area to a clear one -from the jail to the courtyard, lets say- it's to abrupt. Sounds like a silly thing, but it kills me sometimes. Just a minor detail.

I thought I had a problem with finding a key. I saw in a forum discussion that the key of certain door was not yet introduced, and that, therefore, didn't exist. That was sad, since it was relevant to complete a quite important quest, and I thought the quest was impossible to complete then. Took me a day checking the whole world for the key, seeing tutorials and discussions, until I opened my own discussion on the forum. Didn't take more than a night for one of the developers itself awnser kindly my questions, and solve my problems. That's just great, knowing the developers are aware of our issues and there to help us when the time comes. After all the stress of not finding this annoying key, I ended up even more happy with the game, knowing that neither the players nor the game itself are overlooked by the developers.

Anyway, excellent, beautiful and almost perfect game so far! I'm looking forward to the final release; worth every penny. I think it could be one of the prettier games I've played, and it's not like I've played just a few. Thank you! And sorry for my poor english.

33669311.review:
This is my first review so bear with me.

Ghost of a Tale is about a small mouse who was wrongfully imprisoned by a king and was seperated from his wife in the process.  The goal is to help the poor guy escape and determine the whereabouts of his wife.  A very simple story that, quite frankly, I'm okay with.  However, the lore behind this game is far from simple yet the game easily feeds it to you in bite sized chunks that are easy and enjoyable to digest.  The graphics are amazing, far beyond anything that I thought I'd ever see from a team consisting of only five people (one of which worked on 90% of the game by himself).  Gameplay wise this game is amazing and very easy to pick up.  Performance wise it handles like a dream even on my budget desktop.  Honestly the only bad thing I can say about this game are the very few bugs I've come across in my play time and even then the developers are definitely ironing those out at a reasonable pace.  Of course, the game is far from finished given that it is still in early access, but I will say wholeheartedly that I do not regret one bit the $20 I paid for the game as my time with it, however small that might be at the time of this review, was not wasted.  I can't recommend this game enough and I hope to see this game finished in the future.

I give this game a 9/10 even while it's unfinished.

Okay, this is an EA review.

I am in love with this game.  But it is like a long distance relationship.  I dove right in when we first met.  I crept around every corner, inspected every room, and compelted everything I could.  But now I am stand off ish, I don't want to marry someone who is not completely there.

Every single time I open steam I look to see if this game is updating.  I will scroll past other games that are updating, just to see if this one is.  Like waiting for a letter telling me my lost love is coming home.

If you can stand waiting to play more of it, buy it.  If you are curious, and the theme and the gameplay have you interested than you will LOVE it.  

But seriously.  If you have no will power, if you are the kind of person who stays up way to late because you have to finish that TV series in one sitting, the waiting after having had a taste will drive you crazy.  

Ghost of a Tale is a lover worth both waiting for, and jumping right into.   It is not a matter of 'IF' you should buy it, it is a matter of 'when'.

33030449.review:
Et si Castle of Illusions avait été un jeu indépendant? Muni de graphismes à vous scotcher au siège?

C'est exactement la pensée qui m'a traversé l'esprit la première fois que j'ai posé mes mains sur le jeu. Nous y incarnons Tilo, une petite souris coincé dans cellule et qui va partir dans une grande et formidable aventure pour retrouver sa liberté et sa Belle.
Même si le jeu est souvent estampillé "Action RPG", vous pouvez oublier l'action. Tilo est un petit être fragile qui devra faire face à de nombreux dangers et ennemis. Et ne pourra compter que sur sa ruse et sa rapidité pour échapper à ses poursuivants. Cet aspect du jeu rappelle des titres comme Thief, Dishonored, où la furtivité est reine et l'impulsivité synonyme de Mort.
Nous pourrons donc parcourir comme bon nous semble l'immense air de jeu, à la recherche de clefs, d'éléments de quêtes pour enfin nous échapper. Le jeu étant encore en Accès Anticipé, le contenu n'est pas encore complet, mais fournit de quoi occuper (non plutôt passionner) le joueur durant de nombreuses heures.

Le projet est porté par une petite équipe de personnes (avec qui j'ai eu l'occasion de discuter et sont véritablement passionnés par leur projet) avec le rendu d'un AAA, le prix en moins.
Je le recommande sans faute à tout les amateurs d'infiltration, RPG souhaitant appréhender un univers original plein de poésie.

32583038.review:
I read the negatives before buying, most criticisms don't seem to hold up. Played the game with mouse and keyboard and had little issue with it. A few minor bugs that didn't really irritate me that much.

The game is an obvious love letter to the Redwall series and was a lot better than I expected from some of the reviews.  I'm not usually one for Legend of Zelda-esque "puzzle/adventure" games but found this one very interesting. Yes granted it is a series of "Steal X" or "collect X of Y", but boiling something down to "Kill X of Y" or "Collect X of Y" pretty much covers most video games. The key is how well you hide that and how interesting you make the characters. And that seems to be something Ghost of a Tale does very well even without voice acting. No paragraphs of obtuse exposition, just short snippets that give just enough insight into the characters and world to make you sort of want to know more.

I'm looking forward to updates or future games in this universe.

31856157.review:
Je viens de finir le jeu, étant en accès anticipé, je ne m'étais jamais donné la peine d'avancer très loin, mais avec les derniers patchs, le jeu est devenu encore plus intéressant qu'avant.

Tilo malgré sa petite taille, reste un personnage très maniable et hyper expressif. Il suffit de le voir bouger ses petites oreilles pour le trouver attachant. L'aventure que nous promet SeithCG semble fournie et on a pas le temps de s'ennuyer. Sur les 33 quêtes que propose la version Early Access, il y a pas mal de quêtes FedEx, mais ça fait partie du lot de ce genre de jeux.

Ce qui est bluffant, ce sont surtout les possibilités qu'on a pour arriver à la fin des 5-6h de jeu (en finissant 29 quêtes pour ma part et sans vraiment perdre mon temps).

On a des outils qui vont nous servir à beaucoup de choses : éclairer les coins obscurs, distraire les gardes ou les distancer plus facilement voire même les assommer temporairement, déclencher des pièges ou autre...

On peut aussi chercher des costumes qui vont donner à Tilo des aptitudes utiles et augmenter ses capacités (vitesse de sprint, discrétion auditive et visuelle etc...), mais aussi lui permettre de se faire passer pour des figures de légendes dans le background du jeu, ce qui va aussi déverouiller des options de dialogues supplémentaires.

Il y a de tout : des énigmes, des phases un peu tendues, de l'infiltration en veux-tu en voilà.

En fait on al'impression de jouer à un Dark Souls enfantin. On se retrouve dans le même genre de décors, conçus avec un level design vraiment bon et intéressant.

Je n'ai qu'une chose à dire : vivement la suite !!!

31175417.review:
Ghost Of A Tale est un jeu avec beaucoup de potentiel mais je préfère vous en faire la liste en dessous ;


Le premier coup d'oeil :

Alors commençons. Ghost Of A Tale est un Action-RPG sortit le 25 Juin 2016 mais toujours en développement, une Early Acces quoi. Le jeu ON PEUT se le dire est vraiment très beau. Le jeu est d'un style médiéval-fantastique et où nous incarnerons une souris qui c'est faite jetée en prison dont nous ne connaissons pas son histoire a cet instant.

Synopsis :

Le jeu comme, dit précédement, se déroule dans une époque médiéval, nous y incarnons Tilo, une souris ménestrel, qui a été jeté en prison. Il va devoir se débrouiller pour sortir de cette prison pour découvrir la vérté sur son emprisonnement et secourir sa compagne enlevée elle aussi. Vous allez devoir accomplir des quêtes pour des PNJ qui, progressivement, vont vous aider dans votre aventure.

Mécaniques du jeu :
Alors ce que je vais vous dire là ne peux pas vraiment être considéré comme du spoil, si vous avez envie de découvrir tout par vous même je vous conseille d'aller tout de suite jouer au jeu. Durant vos premiers pas dans le jeu vous allez vite faire face à la première menace des rats. Vous inquietez pas car il y a plusieurs manières de vous en débarrasser, vous pouvez leur balancer des objets à la tête, vous cacher dans des coffres ou tout ce qui vous passe sous le nez
et si vous êtes assez inventifs vous pouvez même réussir à les enfermés dans des pièces. A part ça vous pourrez également trouver toutes sortes de steufs en fouillant un peu partout, brefs on est déjà d'après moi devant un bon jeu bien que pas très inovant.

Le temps de jeu :
Petite parenthèse, si vous voulez connaître le temps que vous pourrez passer sur cette Early Acces, pour ma part j'ai mit 10 heures pour le finir en sachant que le jeu est loin d'être finit je trouve que c'est déjà un très bon point qu'il dure si longtemps en Early Acces. Personnellement je pourrais passer mes journées sur ce jeu.

Et pour ceux qui voudrait voir une config. qui le fait fonctionner correctement, GTX 970, i7600, 8G RAM et le jeu tourne à 60 FPS en ultra.

30972336.review:
This is Early Access done right. The Redwall Game I've yearned for!

What you get in this early access is a taste of something rich that sends us back to early days of childhood, but has all the adult undertones needed to stay engaged. 30826393.review:
In it's current state, Ghost of a Tale is a game worth buying only if you're looking for an adventure/stealth game that uses minimal mechanics and puts an emphasis on lore and world building.
The gameplay itself isn't necessarily bad but it could certainly use some variation other than hiding, running, and stunning enemies. The game is also very light on puzzles and the quests eventually devolve into "find this costume," or "collect these things."
If you're looking for a robust Zelda-like experience you won't find it here but what you will find is a game inspired by a plethora of media that is clearly crafted with care and positive intent. Even though Ghost of a Tale is far from perfect in it's current state it is more than worth the money for the world alone. The books, songs, characters, and history all build a solid platform upon which an amazing game can be built. 
If the game featured more puzzles with more items and encounter variations then it could truly be something special. I'm excited to see what this game will become in the coming years and I hope one day I can come back to it and fall in love with it all over again in a different way than before.

30214088.review: I can't understate my love for this game. I grew up reading the Redwall series of books and this game perfectly embodies the spirit of those novels. It also harkens back to my favorite game of all time, Dark Souls 1, through it's intricately crafted world with pathways that loop around back on each other and unlock shortcuts through exploring. The graphics are gorgeous, the animations are beautifully done. The characters have hillarious, endearing, and sometimes crypticly dark dialogue. I love the beautifully stylized medival world with a perfect mix of cute and spooky woven throughout. Though this game is in early access and the playable content is short, I thoroughly enjoyed every minute of it and can't wait to play the full release. Absolutely buy this game if you like stealth and exploration gameplay with morally ambiguous characters and a branching story. You get to play as the worlds most adorable mouse minstrel. That alone is a worthy selling point!

30017838.review:
Has a great deeal of promise, I am looking forward to the finished product. For me, the idea of a stealth game that's not dark and grim is a plus. The pros are great controls, artistically beautiful setting and the charm other reviews have noted.

For what it's worth, my feeling after about 3 hours is that the jail sequence went a bit long. It took me about an hour and half to clear it, having gotten lost in the sewer system and not getting outdoors until I happened across a door lever that I had missed several times while passing through. Hopefully in future releasess the lighting could be improved. Sometimes I got lost not seeing things and I find I had to squint, the game can be very murky in places. 

I look forward to seeing how this develops and can see its potential. Ideally the story will take place in the gorgeous wooded scenes the designer has shown in his blog. The jail/keep area is interesting, but at about the 3 hour mark I felt a bit of fatigue begin to creep in and longed for newer scenery.

Thank you for letting us play this gem in the making.

I haven't played very much of this so far (only about an hour) but everything I've seen has made me question reality.

No, really. How did ONE MAN make THIS for ~$50,000?

I had a lot of fun trying to get a set of keys on a wall that I (a short mouse) simply could not reach. I threw a stick or two at it, to no avail. 29026236.review:
Positives:
=======

+ Polished
+ Graphically gorgeous
+ Unique lore and setting
+ Intelligent, intuitive gameplay mechanics
+ Fantastic worldspace to explore

Negatives:
========

The only things I could possibly perceive as negatives are work in progress, and negligible;
-/+ A handful of bugs (at an incredibly impressive low level for an Early Access title).
-/+ The gameplay could be considered somewhat straightforward, but appeals to a wide audience.


Quite frankly if you're the kind of person who likes to support independent developers, you should buy this. The dedication to their craft, the level of quality of the game and their consistent improvements and bugfixes make SeithCG a developer you should watch out for and support. They're the textbook definition of classy developers.

28965318.review:
I feel compelled to say that this game was a head scratcher in the best of ways! Ghost of a Tale is a game that really makes you have to think about your next move, and at the same time think about the places you've been and almost retrace your steps in the process. 

Not just that, but it has been beautifully crafted, and it's obviously been done with a lot of love. Considering the size of the team creating this thing, and how polished it already is, I can honestly say that I already see this as nothing more than a masterpiece. It's like I'm playing a Pixar version of 'The Secret of Nihm" in real time. It is truely something that you have to behold yourself.

Now you have to understand that this comes from a guy who usually never EVER pays for a game that hasn't already been completed in full. However, in seeing some of what has already been done with this game, and the direction it has taken in the past updates, I can tell you without hesitation that the future is incredibly bright for ths game.

From the amazing graphics, to the backstories, to the subtle twists within, this game deserves every bit of attention it recieves and more. Give it a shot, and, I promise, you won't be dissappointed!

28322418.review:
I just "beat" the early access portion of the game, and I absolutely love it! The art style, character design, writing, and atmosphere are wonderful. The gameplay wasn't exactly what I expected, but it still works well. The stealth elements are very light, and after the initial segment, it opens up into a non-linear questing affair. The quests mostly consist of "find x number of items".

It could be said that the game is too easy, but I would describe it more as casual. This is the game I found myself going to when I wanted to relax and explore. I can see a lot of families playing this with their smaller children. There is peril in the stealth elements, but very little in the way of violence (was there even any blood?) and no gore whatsoever.

I see a lot of potential here, and I'm really really excited for the next update and the final release!

28319102.review:
Pros:
It's beautiful. Really beautiful.
It's incredibly charming.
You care about the characters.
The world created is rich and full of lore, without ever ramming that lore down your throat.
It's funny.
It can be suprisingly tense and scary at times. Probably because you care about the character.
It's about a mouse in a rat castle.

Cons:
It doesn't take very long to finnish.
There's a couple of very minor bugs.

I don't understand why there isn't far more hype and buzz about this game, because it's truly outstanding. Many inferior games have received much more attention. If you're after a hard core stealth game, or a game where you run around killing stuff this isn't it, but you should get it anyway.

28311008.review:
My more detailed video review of the Early Access version can be found here (released October 16th 2016):
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bZ8_IsB6s5w

PROS:
+ Absolutely gorgeous looking visuals with charming art style in high graphical detail.
+ Undeniable atmosphere that mixes cuteness and darkness together seamlessly.
+ Lore and characters are actually interesting and well written.
+ Great controls (tested with Xbox 360 controller).
+ Good level design.

CONS:
- VERY easy.
- Minor bugs.

28296273.review:
Pros:

-Visuals. It looks great, not just in terms of graphically fidelity which is of a quality I would expect from a larger studio, but with design.  How could anyone look a Tilo and not think that is adorable? The animations are also very well done. Not surprising given the devs background. 

- Writing. The story so far is intriguing, the characters are distinct and the dialogue is humorous. 

-World building. A lot of effort seems to have gone into fleshing out the wider world, in particular the culture of the mice. I highly recommend taking the time to read the item descriptions and the additional information on specific terms that appear in dialogue. It really helps bring the world to life. 

-Good level design. The level loops around on itself with plenty of shortcuts to open. This is particularly important as there is a fair amount of toing and froing.

Cons (bearing in mind this early access):

-Stealth is a little simple for my taste, especially since this is the bread and butter of the game. The rats are so much slower than Tilo so you can pretty much just sprint past everything and healing items are all over the place. 

-No voiceovers. I don’t usually mind this but you are playing a bard and he sings to other characters. It would be great to hear him sing (even if the rest of the dialouge isn't voiced).

-Glitches, sometimes the rats get stuck and you have to exit to the main menu to fix this. 

-The quest at this point in time are almost entirely “go find some things scattered around the map”. I wish there more variation. While combat would not fit it could have more puzzles and utilise the costumes more.

27934030.review:
Que ce soit dans son visuel ou dans sa maniabilité Ghost of a Tales est très agréable et reposant à jouer, il m'est arrivé de m'arreter dans ma progression pour profiter de certains détails du jeu, tel que la façon d'on réagis l'eau quand on s'y déplace.

Avec ce jeu je redécouvre cette sensation perdu par les jeux actuels qui ce "rush", celle de l'exploration. Prendre plaisir à chercher dans des lieux parfois les plus improbables, sans vraiment savoir sur quoi l'on va tomber. découvrir morceau par morceau l'histoire de notre personnage, des lieux toujours plus beaux les uns que les autres.

je ne vais pas rentrer dans les détails du jeu comme son système de dialogue, ses armures etc, car au moment ou je rédige cette évaluation il est difficile de se faire un avis final sur celui ci vu qu'il est en accès anticipé et que même si le contenu est de qualité il est tout de même loin d'être complet.

Etant devenu a juste titre très frileux vis à vis des accès anticipé, j'ai tout de même souhaité acheter ce jeu dans le but de soutenir le projet et de le voir fini afin d'en profiter pleinement quand ça sera le cas.

[b][u]Graphismes :[/u]
☑ Superbe
☐ Excellents
☐ Bons
☐ Acceptables
☐ Moches[/b]

Savoir que ce jeu est fait sur Unity est pas forcément surprenant mais il fait réaliser que ce moteur graphique est vraiment loin d'avoir montré toutes ces capacités.

[b][u]Jouabilité :[/u]
☐ Parfaite
☐ Agréable 
☑ Bonne
☐ Perturbante
☐ Injouable[/b]

- Malgré ma notation sur bonne, je dois avouer que j'ai préférer jouer à la manette a cause de problèmes de configuration de touche pour le clavier. mais c'est probablement déjà résolu.
- Au début la caméra peut parfois être perturbante à cause notament des collisions mais le coup de main viens rapidement et je dois avouer ne pas être particulièrement fan d'un gameplay manette, donc probablement que mon avis n'est pas tout à fait juste.

[b][u]Durée de vie :[/u]
☐ Très longue
☐ Longue 
☐ Standard
☐ Courte
☑ Très courte[/b]

Bon la forcément Il est difficile de juger la durée de vie d'un jeu qui n'est pas terminé, mais si je devais donner une idées du temps de jeu actuel, il est entre 5 et 8 heure selon votre rapidité en cherchant à tout découvrir.

[b][u]Bande son :[/u]
☐ Magnifique
☐ Parfait
☑ Bonne
☐ Moyenne
☐ Ridicule[/b]

Pour l'instant les seules musiques sont trop peut présente en jeu pour les juger, même si elles sont agréables elles ne sont pas présentes à l'heure actuelle dans la phase de gameplay.
Mais ce n'est pourtant pas une mauvaise chose, cela ajoute de l'immersion et permet de bien entendre le bruit des gardes et autres créatures étranges.
Même si cela peut changer à l'avenir, mieux vaut pas avoir de musique qu'une musique inadapter.

[b][u]Scénario :[/u]
☐ Surprenant
☐ Très bon
☐ Classique
☐ Aucun
☐ Stupide[/b]

Pour avoir un jugement objectif il faudra attendre d'avoir le scénario au complet. l'accès anticipé nous montre qu'il y a bien une histoire mais on en sais trop peut pour se faire un avis pour le moment.

[b][u]Rapport qualité/prix :[/u]
☐ C'est donné !
☐ Il mérite son prix
☑ Juste ce qu'il faut
☐ Attendre une promo
☐ En plus il faut payer ?[/b]

Alors oui, malgré ses nombreuses qualités on en reviens toujours au problème de l'accès anticipé. le travail est soigné et vraiment plaisant mais l'expérience de jeu actuelle est trop courte, alors certe vous pouvez faire comme moi et l'acheter dans le but de soutenir et attendre les mises à jour.
Mais si vous souhaitez immédiatement rentabiliser votre achat et bien le prix est juste ce qu'il faut. Mais je pense qu'une foi terminé il méritera de loin son prix.


[b][u]Points positifs :[/u]
● Un visuel et des animations très belles
● Le plaisir d'explorer
● Un gameplay très simple à prendre en main[/b]

[b][u]Points négatifs :[/u]
● l'IA n'est pas assez difficile (peut être un choix de difficulté plus tard?).
● Quelques soucis de confort de caméra dans les endroits étroits.
● Ca n'est pas un défaut pour tous mais le jeu est entièrement en anglais (pour l'instant?).[/b]

27666475.review:
Sehr vielversprechend. Und so putzig!
Außerdem scheint die Spielwelt schon jetzt einiges mehr Substanz und Tiefe zu haben, als die grundlegende Thematik vermuten lässt. (Maus in mittelalterlicher Fantasywelt beherrscht von Ratten sucht seine Frau und sieht dabei süß aus) Das liegt auch an den schönen (englischen) Texten, der Musik, den recht interessanten Charakteren und nicht zuletzt an dem feinen Leveldesign.

Nur am Gameplay müsste noch gefeilt werden, da gibt es noch einige Bugs. Außerdem sind einige Aufgaben sehr repetitiv und langwierig. Die Performance ging auch an bestimmten Stellen in den Levels etwas in die Knie, vielleicht gibt es da auch noch Optimierungsmöglichkeiten.

Wünsche diesem Spiel das Beste. Die Early-Access Version hat einem schon mal das große Potential gezeigt, jetzt muss das nur noch ausgeschöpft werden. :)

27411814.review:
Как человек, взращенный на книгах и мультфильмах об антропоморфных мышах из аббатства Рэдволл и любящий их всем своим сердцем, я просто не могла пройти мимо этой игры. Надеюсь, когда-нибудь полноценная игра всё же выползет из раннего доступа.

Плюсы:

+ Графическая составляющая. Игра не особо требовательная, качество текстур на уровне и в ней очень приятная анимация
+ Персонажи. Ну вы только посморите на них и на их шевелящиеся усики
+ Квесты. Они здесь есть и они невероятно интересны
+ Игровой лор и количество внутриигрового текста. Здесь есть просто тонны разных записочек, книг и диалогов. И они тоже интересны;
+ Внимание к деталям и левел дизайн
+ Своеобразные Collectables, выраженные расбросанными по всей игре костюмчиками для мышонка. Советую собирать их не только людям, любящим их собирать, но и вообще всем, потому что одежда даёт неплохие бонусы
+ Стелс. Местный стелс - всем стелсам стелс. У местных врагов зрение совсем не тоннельное и слышат они чертовски хорошо. Но в изобилии разбросанные укрытия делают уровень сложности умеренным и не действующим на нервы
 
Минусы:
- Иногда некритично ломается управление
- Очень редко игра может вылетать во время сохранения. Поэтому советую сохраняться как можно чаще, чтобы не терять игровой прогресс

Спорное:
= Русского языка в игре нет. Я знаю английский язык на достаточном уровне, чтобы языковой барьер не был проблемой, но кого-то он может оттолкнуть, учитывая объемы текстов в игре


Итог: игру советую. Она просто неповторимая 9.9/10

Итак, эта игра действительно понравилась мне еще до того, как стала хитом. Игра, по сути, находится в разработке и игрокам доступны лишь некоторые прелести этого чуда. НО! Я точно знаю, что мне понравится, я жду конечный продукт с нетерпением. Мне нравится все: красочные локации, уникальные герои со своими забавными диалогами (чего только стоят лягуха-пират или мышки воришки). Mesmo estando em Early Access eu já recomendo muito [b]Ghost of a Tale[/b]. Em poucos minutos ele me segurou como poucos jogos conseguiram. Extremamente carismático, bonito e divertido.

O jogo acompanha as aventuras do pequenino herói Tilo, um camundongo-bardo que foi capturado por ratos gigantes e precisa escapar de suas masmorrras; desvendando misterios do seu passado e do mundo do jogo no caminho. As mecânicas misturam vários gêneros, de jogos de plataforma a Stealth.

26702324.review:
Pros:
+Good Presentation (Graphics, animation quality, sound, etc.) It really looks nice, and I would believe you if you told me this game was made by a big budget studio.
+Great Writing. Despite the lack of voice overs, the sense of humor and amount of character put into the writing is very entertaining and believable.
+Great content to map size ratio. Despite there only being 3 main areas, none of which are that large, the level design, quests, and characters dispersed throughout actually give you a lot to do and explore in each one.
+Intriguing Story, though unfinished. Since its in Early Access, you get kind of blue balled once the content is cut off, but enough was there to get me interested in the main characters.
+Limitless potential if further development continues at a steady pace

Cons:
-Mediocre optimization. Motion blur significantly reduces framerate, and certain areas my framerate was halved. Random huge frame drops for 1-2 seconds on occasion as well. I have a GTX 1060, which is by no means a weak card.
-Barebones main stealth mechanic. For a game designed purely on stealth, the stealth mechanic is a little bland. It uses a simple system where line of sight and your movement near enemies increases their awareness of you, and once the awareness bar reaches full, you're caught. Only, not really, because you can just outrun the guards and hide as soon as you break line of sight, and they make no attempt to search the hiding spots.
-Currently, not enough content. I don't think the amount of game justifies its price. I'm writing this immediately after I beat it (not 100%, but pretty close, 24/26 quests completed) so my time played (4-5 hours) is accurate to around how long it'll take you to finish. If you do decide to purchase it consider it a donation to help move development along, not as a purchase of a full game. Which you should be doing for every EA title, honestly.

Things of Note:
=As of this review, there is absolutely no combat. Purely stealth. There are outfits that provide various bonuses, but they don't affect gameplay significantly enough to really make a huge difference other than aesthetics. This is not the Dark Souls: Prepare to Mice Edition you're looking for.
=Controller STRONGLY recommended. Despite not being DS:PtME, it still needs a controller about as badly. Keyboard controls are pretty wonky, and don't allow to walk, which affects your ability to sneak.
=No voiceovers. It'd be really nice if they could find some really good VA's, but I'd rather them stick to text than get someone to phone it in.
=Occasional bugginess, as should be expected with early access titles.

Overall, I think this game is well worth supporting. The setting is something we really don't see in action games too often, and while the story is rather simple, it's still interesting and well written enough to keep players invested. Keep in mind my main gripes about this game are on the technical side, and will likely be remedied as it is developed.

25867138.review:
There really is something quite magical about this game. It has some serious Rats of Nimh feelings to it, and thats just fine by me!
There's some great passion being put into Ghost of a Tale that will guarantee that you'll see this reach the light of day.
Like some of you, I'm tpyically skeptical of throwing money at Early Access, but this game has been on my wishlist for a while now. Since getting a greatly upgraded gaming rig from a friend, I finally have the power to play something like this, and it was well worth the wait! This really is a charming game where the "little guy" can make all the difference.

Don't let the animal visuals fool you however, there's some decent stealth gameplay at work here that can often feel tense in the right ways. Think of this as the Rodent version of a Thief game and you'd be pretty close.

I absolutely do recommend this, if only to see the red glow of the mouse's ears when light catches behind them!
It still needs some work here and there. The quests could do with a little bit more polish (it can get overwhelming as to where to go and what to do) and I'd like to see combat implemented, but I think that's on its way.
Right now what you're getting for your money is the beautiful beginnings of a well thought out world and a good chunk of stealthy-playground to sneak around in.

25594550.review:
Наверное, каждый из нас в детстве любил слушать интересные сказки, в которых главный герой спасает свою возлюбленную, после чего они живут долго и счастливо. Игр с подобным сюжетом и сказочным сеттингом в последнее время довольно мало, но еще меньше качественных игр. Исходя из этого проект Ghost of a Tale, разрабатывающийся инди-студией SeithCG, вызывал некоторые опасения. К счастью, большая их часть не подтвердилась.

Сейчас об игре судить еще очень рано, так как она находится в раннем доступе и такие вещи, как баги и проседания FPS при переходе между локациями, иногда встречаются. Несмотря на это, Ghost of a Tale способна с самого начало очаровать, прежде всего, главным персонажем. Играем мы за маленького мышонка-менестреля по имени Тило, который ищет свою возлюбленную Мерру. Мышонок должен преодолеть множество опасностей, расспросить большое количество персонажей и выяснить, где же находится его любовь.

Сеттинг игры переносит нас в средневековый мир, где практически всеми персонажами являются животные. Все это очень сильно напоминает вселенную мультсериала «Рэдволл», главным героем которого также является мышонок. Основными врагами в Ghost of a Tale являются крысы – надзиратели замка, который мы собственно и исследуем. Сражаться Тило не умеет, а поэтому передвигаться предстоит очень скрытно – в стелс-режиме. Крысы отлично видят, и с легкостью замечают главного героя даже если он мельком пробежал мимо них. Узнать видит ли нас враг, можно при помощи значка, расположенного над ним. В большинстве случаев противников можно обманывать, отвлекая их и прячась в бочках и сундуках.

Помимо стелс-составляющей, в Ghost of a Tale есть и доля RPG. Мы можем собирать различные предметы вроде одежды, еды, ламп и всевозможных палок, которые можно бросать, отвлекая тем самым противников или активируя механизмы. На одежде хочется остановиться поподробнее – Тило может переодеваться в пирата, надевать стильные сапожки, шляпы и т.п. Примечательно, что это влияет не только на его характеристики, но и на отношение к нему других персонажей при диалогах. Кстати о них, в игре нам часто предстоит разговаривать с персонажами, выпрашивая у них квесты и выведывая ценную информацию.

Диалоги полностью интерактивны, что позволяет нам самим выбирать фразы, которые должен сказать главный герой. В диалогах мы не раз сможем услышать от NPC довольно остроумную шутку, добавляющую плюсик к общему настроению. Также новую информацию об игровом мире и заданиях мы сможем получать благодаря книгам и запискам – текста в Ghost of a Tale достаточно много. К сожалению, сейчас игра локализована только на английский язык, но на выходе не исключено, что продукт переведут и на другие языки, в том числе и русский.

По части графики Ghost of a Tale занимает высокую нишу. Анимации выполнены очень симпатично, напоминая высокобюджетный мультфильм. К плюсам также можно отнести и художественный стиль – локации и персонажи нарисованы со вкусом. Благодаря этому, несложно проникнуться в игровую атмосферу, сказочную и такую добрую.

Сложно представить современную сказку, лишенную качественного музыкального сопровождения. В Ghost of a Tale разработчики знают об этом, а поэтому не забыли наделить свой продукт отличной музыкой, вписывающейся в атмосферу. К слову, мы ведь играем за менестреля – куда же без музыки?!

К минусам игры можно отнести разве что не самую лучшую оптимизацию и наличие багов. Иногда враги застревают в текстурах, а количество кадров в секунду падает при переходе в новую локацию. К счастью, баги не очень частое явление, в отличие от проседания FPS. Естественно, скорее всего, данные недостатки поправят в финальной версии Ghost of a Tale. Уже сейчас можно заявить, что игра получилась великолепной – в меру наивный сюжет, который будет интересен как детям, так и взрослым геймерем, отличная графика и необычный сеттинг, подкупающий с первых минут прохождения заставляют ждать финальной версии.

С обзором можно ознакомиться на [url=http://playinfo.net/predvaritelnyiy-obzor-ghost-of-a-tale-krasivaya-skazka/]Playinfo.net[/url]

   [b]乌鸦暗示谋杀 [/b]

25470615.review:
I became aware of this game after seeing Will Strife on Youtube play it. I only watched for five minutes before I exclaimed "I love it already" upon seeing a small mouse with his little hat running around a rat infested jail. And that's always a good sign. I closed the video after that to not spoil myself further. I wanted to experience it myself.

The game is a stealthy action game with RPG elements in it. You have food to raise your health after being hurt, tools like candles and sticks to help progress, and articles of clothing that you can find scattered across the world that improve your stats or help disguise you if you find a full set.

You can hide in the same barrels and chests you loot, providing safe places where you can save your game. This is a dynamic I really enjoy.

There's something special about Ghost of a Tale that really struck the right notes for me. I found myself getting immersed in my character and the world that slowly revealed itself around him. I was a small mouse, thrown in a jail that was guarded by patrolling rats that were twice the size of me. This helped cement the fact that I wouldn't be defending myself anytime soon. I was a tiny mouse, so the best thing I had was to hide and run away.

As I journeyed through the sewers and halls of the jail I slowly uncovered little factoids and lore about this fantasy world. A world of a rat based kingdom who were at war with the ferrets, a world with sea fairing frogs and all these words and items that don't exist in our world. All of this world building helps my personal experience significantly!

However, like all early access games, Ghost of a Tale is not without its share of glitches. Mostly gameplay related, these glitches would usually prevent me from enjoying the game to its fullest potential.

My character would frequently become frozen in place, usually after reloading a save and exiting a hiding spot. This glitch could only be fixed by closing the game completely and reloading and this only pulled me out of the experience.

Sometimes the effects of clothing remain even when the item is removed. This usually happened after quickly dipping into my inventory screen, removing a hat, and quickly closing it. I often remained slowed because of the heavy armor I wasn't wearing anymore or had my screen darkened by a mask I was no longer wearing. This was easily fixed by a quick unequip/reequip, but its worth mentioning.

Map markers had a habit of remaining on the screen even if I got the item it was directing me to. This worried me because now I was dead set and searching every nook and cranny, even inch of the area to make absolutely sure that I got the item it was point to. Compared to the map markers that disappeared like they were suppose to, the ones that remained happened about 35% of the time.

Talking to NPCs continued to be a worrisome task for me. Sometimes the game would glitch out when I talked to other characters. I even had a character's dialogue screen remain on the screen, forcing me to quit the game. Anytime I selected an option in the dialogue tree that require me to scroll down a bit in the options, the game would remember the scrolling down and transmit that data to the next dialogue prompt, resulting in a worrisome blank screen with no options until I scrolled up. For most of it, it ran smooth enough and worked, but its very rough around the edges and could use a good working on.

I finished the game in about five hours and I feel like I moved rather quickly through it. I was thirsty for a new area, I wanted to get out of this jail as soon as possible. I wanted to save my wife! I want to see more content and hope there's much much more to come!

What worries me is that this game might become neglected like many early access games before it. I worry that the company will lose interest, take what money they earned and move on, leaving the game by the wayside. But I really REALLY don't want that to happen!

If you enjoy sneaking around in a world of anthropomorphic animals with a medieval theme, I would definitely recommend this game!

25445526.review:
[h1] DISCLAIMER: This is a first impressions review, and NOT a full review, if you want a full review, then please read better reviews then mine [/h1]

[quote] PLEASE NOTE: This review is/was written when this game was in/is still in Early Access. Think twice before buying/playing this game [/quote]

This is how Early Access is meant to be done... yet again!

Ghost of a Tale is a game developed by SeithCG. It encorporates stealth with adventure and puzzles whilst in a RPG world, at first I wasn't entirely sure of what this game was or what the story behind it is, but this becomes clear very quickly and very strongly. The character designs are fantastic and have a really unique feel to them

The writing is fantastically (although still in Early Access) is well done and really compelling, this is one of the very few games that I actually wouldn't mind doing the side quests for, even though this game is still in Early Access, it certainly doesn't feel like an Early Access game (apart from the odd graphical or gameplay glitch but that's understandable)

The animations are incredible, things such as climbing and the way Tilo (the cute little mouse :3) interacts with small ledges and stairs as well as Tilo's movement feels fantastic, and looks realistic in the meantime being absolutely adorable as well. There is the few animation glitches here and there but I am sure that they will be ironed out in upcoming updates

I am totally in love with the level of detail in the environments, the quality of textures on pretty much everything I've seen from Tilo's fur to the grains of barrels and such, it all looks really good and I can't wait to see a whole world come to life in this depth and style as the game develops further. And surprisingly enough, this was all made on the Unity engine! UNBELIEVABLE!?!

Ghost of a Tale in its current state is a must buy and there is already hours of content readily available to you even though it is in Early Access, I cannot wait to see what this game has to offer as it progresses down the development path and I hope it will become one of the greatest indie stealth RPG gamnes thus far!

25412547.review:
Wow. What a game! I played this throughout the night and morning.
I can't add much to this review that hasn't already been said before by others, but I'll break down some pros and cons.

Pros:
- Looks incredible
- Ambiance - Despite being a very cute, the jails and sewers were very off-putting (in a good way!). Chains rattling, the music, the lighting... It made me expect something bad to happen even in places I'd been through a few times. Kept me on my feet.
- Interesting lore and world building - There has been a lot of effort in world building, and I really feel like a small mouse in a big world so far.
- Witty and funny writing - I didn't expect the writing to be as funny as it is. Had quite a few laugh out loud moments.
- Great characters - This goes along with the above point
- Fun gameplay mechanics/puzzles - Utilizing the environment to reach keys and other objects was fun, and the stealth mechanics were good (albeit a bit buggy, more on that below). The jail really reminded me of the prison from Wind Waker (Except fun).
- Level design - The areas remind me of Dark Souls. Very beautiful scenery, even in the dankest parts of the jail. There are plenty of shortcuts you can unlock through the game to help access past areas faster.

Cons (Mostly bugs):
- Platforming - This may be just me, but I  found it very hard to perform some platforming jumps in the later area of the game to reach some of the side-quest items. Tilo seemed really stiff and never wanted to face in the exact direction I pointed him in. I'm sure these will be matted out in the final release.
- Enemy AI - The enemies would sometimes bug out, they'd get alerted to me and stay still, or remain stuck for the rest of the game, etc. These should ironed out in the final release.
- Sometimes my game wouldn't let me pick up an item on the ground unless I was looking at it at a very specific angle, especially on tables and keys knocked onto the floor from hooks.
- Poorly optimized - This will improve with the final release I'm sure.

And finally...
- Left me wanting to play more! This game is fun! I can not wait for the rest of the game to be released, as well as more of the world.
Seith and his team should really be proud of themselves. They're working on an incredible game that deserves recognition.

25405372.review:
[b]See written review below[/b] or watch it here: https://youtu.be/9SzFo06e1OI
[h1]THIS IS A MIXED PREVIEW! TL;DR: SKIP TO CONCLUSION[/h1]

Ghost of a Tale is an action RPG adventure, with a strong focus on stealth and exploration.

You play as a mouse named Tilo, in a world full of animals. You have been separated from your wife, and you must use your wits, and the help of others to make your way back to her.

The game has a heavy focus on exploration, and there are a lot of collectibles to find. Many of which will be required for different quests, but some others are optional. I especially like the different clothing items, and once you obtain the full set, you can disguise yourself to trick those around you.

Stealth makes up a large portion of the game as well. It’s nice that there is a very clear indication of how close you are to being seen or heard, and to tell whether or not you’re hidden. Stealthing around is enjoyable, but when you get found, you are still be able to escape and hide without too much difficulty. If you do happen to get hit by an enemy, there is plenty of food around to consume and heal back up.

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
[list][*]exploration is enjoyable, and there are lots of collectibles to find
[*]the stealth mechanics are simple to understand, yet effective at the same time, and those who love exploring and finding all the collectibles to enjoy themselves without stressing too much about being discovered
[*]environments are absolutely gorgeous; the world is so beautiful, and extremely immersive
[*]character design is fantastic - excellent attention to detail (Tilo is so adorable with his little tail and whiskers)
[*]music and sound effects are done very well (part of me wishes there was some voice acting, but it makes more sense that there isn’t)
[*]the text dialog between characters is written well, and the characters feel like they have their own personalities; the dialog is believable, and the conversations feel genuine
[*]inventory management is minimal, and items are easy to swap out (the game would benefit from the addition of inventory hotkeys or quickslots though)[/list]

[h1]Cons:[/h1]
[list][*]only 25-30% of the content compared to what is expected for full release is available, so the content is a bit lacking for the full price (as expected)
[*]the more hard-core stealth fans will find the game too easy, and too forgiving - the game would definitely benefit from having more challenging difficulty settings available
[*]some minor bugs that you can easily avoid, and a couple other more severe bugs that require reloading a save or restarting the game (which is a minor inconvenience)[/list]

[h1]Conclusion:[/h1]
I have played about 4.5 hours so far, and I have completed nearly all of the available quests, and found almost all of the collectible items. The game is fairly polished, but as expected in early access, there are some bugs that still need to be addressed. Some bugs are very minor, but there were a couple bugs where I needed to reload a save or restart the game. I’ve really enjoyed the game so far though, and I’m definitely looking forward to the full release of the game. Admittedly, the content is a bit lacking for the full price right now, but Ghost of a Tale is off to a fantastic start. If you’re interested in an adorable RPG adventure with stealth and exploration, and you’re interested in supporting the game as it develops, this is  certainly a game worth checking out.

If you like my reviews, please feel free to join my Steam group, and follow my curations [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/AzralynnReviews#curation]here.[/url]
You can also view this review on my website [url=http://www.azralynn.com/ghost-of-a-tale-early-access/]here.[/url]

25309749.review:
[h1] Information [/h1]

Dieses Spiel befindet sich noch in der Early Accessphase und ist laut Entwickler bisher zu 20-25% fertig gestellt.

[h1] Gameplay [/h1]

Ghost of a Tale ist ein Stealthgame. Du erkundest als kleine Maus die Welt, dabei muss man sich vor den großen Rattenwachen verstecken (es gibt kein Kampfsystem, zumindest noch nicht). Auf unserer Reise treffen wir auf andere Personen, lösen Quests und entdecken verschiedene Geheimnisse.

[h1] Grafik [/h1]

Die Grafikengine in Ghost of a Tale sieht erstaunlich gut aus. Animationen sind glatt und die Bewegungen der Hauptfigur gehen gut von der Hand.

[h1] Pro [/h1] 

- KI denkt mit

- es gibt verschiedene Kostüme und andere Gegenstände, die teilweise gut versteckt sind

- Level-Design ist gut gewählt und wurde gut in das Spiel integriert

- FPS laufen stabil und das ohne Einbrüche

- kann mit Tastatur/Maus und Controller gespielt werden, allerdings ist die Controllervarinate besser

[h1] Kontra [/h1] 

- das Interface ist noch ein bisschen durcheinander z.B bei der Zuordnung der einzelnen Gegenstände

[h1] Fazit [/h1]

Ghost of a Tale ist das bisher beste Early Access Projekt, das ich seit langem gespielt habe. Im Gegensatz zu anderen spielen, spielt es sich jetzt schon, wie ein vollwertiger AAA-Titel.

25004194.review:
This is the first review I've ever written.  Well not review, but just my view of this game.  I will begin by saying when they spoke of drawing inspiration from Redwall, suddenly my nostalgic heart strings were tugged on.  I immediately started recalling the stories that I read and am going to have to find the books to read them again.  I always wanted to know what that world would look like if it were fully realized in either a movie or a video game.  Holy hell they pulled it off perfectly!  This game looks incredible from an art style.  The entire purpose is that you are a little mouse but the world is tailored for small creatures.  Some call it animorphic, its simply the little creatures can speak and act as though they are living in a human world. 

I wanted to stay in the game world forever.  After you play the game for a couple hours, you begin to notice the detail that went in to creating this environment.  Another thing I am a huge fan of, is rather than focusing on how BIG they can make the game world, they create a small area with lots of stuff to do and find.  It is your standard fetch quest, occassional puzzle, and exploration driven gameplay, but I found it enjoyable because I was in an intresting game world that evolved the longer I played.  Mice in this world wear hats that show what their job is.  It means that you will be wearing a lot of differnet outfits, and each one will be useful in some way such as speaking with NPC's who react differently depending on what you are wearing.  

I didn't even mind having to go back to places I had been before, there are little short cuts you can find, you master sneaking past all the guards while being efficient.  I really felt like I was that mouse trying to survive this crazy prison.  I cannot wait for them to finish this game, I got to the Early Access ending and immediately wanted more.  I look forward to seeing how this story evolves, I hope there are a lot of friendly NPC's in a small nearby village, I just want to get to know more about this world.  

Please.  Give.  Me.  More.

24943445.review:
3 hours in and I had to stop because it's 6:30am.

I'll try to be brief then with my feelings on this game so far.

~ I wasn't entirely sure at the outset but this game's charm becomes clear very quickly and very strongly. Character designs are novel and have a really unique kind of feel to them stylistically. 

~ The writing is fantastically well done and really compelling, I'm going to try and do every quest in this early build just because this game, unlike many others, makes me want to do the little side quests - in particular the rose collecting quest, which I have 8/9 of currently (can't find the one near Rolo's smithy), and the story told from this quest is not only really neatly woven into what seems to be a main story thread, but it is also charming, endearing, and saddening all at once.

~ The animation is very nice, it feels like there's a lot of Inverse Kinematics going on with things like climbing and the way Tilo interacts with small ledges and stairs (to a point). Moreover Tilo's movement feels fantastic, and looks really well considered as well as being absolutely adorable as well. There are naturally hiccups, but I'm impressed so far with him and the rats as well, with how they move so... Stalking and menacing, I really did feel their steely gazes and imposing frames at every turn.

~ Graphical fidelity has never been something I've valued above all else, and I'm used to sacrificing that for a consistent, smoother experience. I am however totally in love with the detail in the environments, the quality of textures on pretty much everything I've seen from Tilo's fur to the grains of barrels and such, it all looks really good and I can't wait to see a whole world come to life in this depth and style as the game develops further.

~ Technically speaking... I need a better machine to truly appreciate what this game can do. Certainly optimization and engine management comes into it but it performs very nicely for me at this point - though the AI in certain places can bug out significantly. Definitely heed the words, "Save early, save often." That having been said my opinions echo those of Jim Sterling here: if this is the worst the game can show me, I really am not going to complain about the AI occasionally (only happened once in 3 hours of play) wigging out.

~ I nearly lost it when I read "Curled Tails" - I forget the actual book name but it's close at least. Being that I've done a lot of writing in my time, I thought that was a particularly poignant and smart jab at erotic (and especially erotic furry) fiction. Yes, a LOT of such stories are exactly like that.

So much for keeping it short... but those are my thoughts so far. I love this game, and can't wait to see more.

Negative: More fetch quests than you can throw a bone at. Will often lead you back previous areas in a roundabout and tedious fashion.

24902545.review:
Ghost of a Tale is an amazing little indie stealth game with high production values despite mostly being made by one person. It has a great vibe reminiscent of the Redwall book series or the classic film, Secret of Nimh.

While the story is not amazing, the game features some great, quirky characters with amazing dialogue. Artistically, the game is beautiful. The lighting and attention to detail in every space is impressive to say the least. This game has a day and night cycle which changes certain gameplay elements such as finding beetles that make noise at night and affecting visibility. The sound effects are fantstic and the limited music is quite good. The overall presentation helps create an incredibly immersive experience. 

The stealth gameplay is solid with lots of cupboards, baskets, chests and barrels to hide in. While the enemy AI is pretty basic and is easily fooled, they are still quite scary due to you being a mostly defenseless mouse. Finding keys, changing gear, and doing quests are all well executed with strong story driven context.  Its great to see someone doing something new in the stealth space and I am very happy to say this one is worth the price of admission.   GG!

Summary - at 4hrs in I am already satisfied that the available content will be worth the investment price.  And that content is only 1/3 of what the full game will be.  This is an Early Access game you should seriously consider getting.


My full thoughts thus far:
Wow.
Just wow.

So far this appears to be a no-combat stealth game and this is a really great thing.  I am really enjoying some of the mechanics built into the game to make sneaking feel more realistic and challenging, given that you are a mouse. I wont share details because I think this game is something each player should experience for themselves firsthand. But those mechanics make this a rewarding experience.

And then there is the feel of the game.  Between the sounds, visual style, characters and their animations, the tips that tell you more about the world, and so much more, I am already feeling immersed in this game.  The setting is just so....exactly what you would expect if you were a harmless mouse surrounded by big freaky rats who can kill you with one blow.  And there have been so many moments in my short playtime where I have thought as I was playing "I can do that!?  Of course I can do that, I'm a mouse.  Thats so cool!"

Complaints about graphical bugs aside, I do hope they change the way NPC text types itself out (I would prefer it shows up instantly), and if they added voices to the NPC's it would be even more impressive.  but the chat system is definitely more interesting than the standard "select a dialogue choice" and makes each NPC feel distinct.
