24544336.review:
Been following this game for a few years now on occasion - meaning, every time I could remember its name: luckily "Redwall like game" or "Mouse Guard like game" or sometimes "Game where the protagonist is a mouse -controls" normally led to finding it yet again. My surprise grew as I saw it available on early access and despite my general aversion to this release model, "Ghost of a Tale" has a unique enough setup to take the risk.

The game is visually competent, and is driven by tight controls and a reasonable amount of lore and background infos to help the player immerse into its charming world. Gameplay-wise, you take control of minstrel Tilo and navigate him through rat-ridden corridors (the "enemies" aren't stereotypical bad guys, which I appreciate a lot), while always trying to remain unseen: if a fight breaks loose, the only means of defense are to throw stuff at the aggressor or, better yet, run away and hide. 

Only two hours in, I already feel fatigue regarding this mechanic, since the enemies so far are easy to see through and not very clever: having to backtrack certain parts of the castle through the exact same setup of guards (or rather "moving obstacles") doesn't help the cause too much. Right now, my "thumbs up" rating is to be seen with a grain of salt: the game - considering its early access state - is too good to be punished with a mean, old, red thumb. For later builds however, I'm hoping for greater gameplay variety. At the moment, the formula is too simple to carry through a whole game, no matter how inviting the world, its inhabitants and their cultures are.

24543517.review:

24538888.review:
So, I haven't really followed this game since the kickstarter which gave me a very different impression of what the game was meant to be. It looked more to be Dark Souls with mice back at the time. I suppose I'm a little happy they changed direction since we've been flooded with souls-esque games as of late. Still, it is a bit disappointing since the game showed so much promise.

Regardless, the game we have now is very good. A stealth adventure game VERY reminiscent of the PS2 era (gameplay wise) which some brilliant art design and fantastic dialogue. The game isn't nearly complete yet and it just oozes with an interesting world and story.  I love the little personal touches with the species and stereotypes/racism. Lots of personality. 

Obviously the game is still early on in its development, but what we have right now is very promising and a fairly enjoyable experience. It's perhaps a little repetitive gameplay wise, not sure how to fix that when the direction of the game is avoiding combat now, but it's still very early on. 

My biggest complaint is that the game's performance is somewhat poor. I'm hoping it'll be touched up a bit more towards release, as right now the framerate dips are killing my enjoyment a bit. It's still a very cool indie adventure game and worth a look, I wouldn't reccomend any medium/low end rigs try to run the game in its current state however.

24535516.review:
The first thing you should know is that, yes, this is an early access game with only 25% or so of it's content available at present - this makes up 2 - 3  hours of playtime. What you get however is a charming and little game that's fun to play and runs well for an early access title all the while looking very good indeed. There's definitely a few bugs here and there, but the game doesn't look bad or run poorly like the majority of early access titles out there which is a huge positive given it's only just been released. It's worth mentioning that there's no fighting in this game - as a small mouse, your tools in a combat situation are mostly just running and hiding. 

The game has simple stealth elements based on sound (proximity) and line of sight. Currently the stealth mechanics are perhaps a little basic and could use some embellishment via improving the enemy AI and adding more stealth mechanics, but as is it functions fairly well and is simple enough for just about anybody to get the hang of very quickly.

Despite that though, the rest of the game really doesn't hold your hand. You'll be spending a lot of time searching for things - and there's no minimaps, on screen quest trackers or even arrows pointing you to where you need to go - with often very limited assistance from your quest menu and a basic map of the area (once you've found it!) you're mostly on your own. This will appeal to a lot of older generaton gamers, but perhaps new gamers will find it quite frustrating. 

One area the game shines in so far is the NPCs. There's only 5 NPC's in the game right now, but each of them is well written with distinctive personalities and great dialog. 

Overall, the game is well worth playing in it's current state, but perhaps not worth the asking price as-is - however, once the game is complete, it will be a bargain for it's price, and if Ghost of a Tale seems like a game that would appeal to you, I implore you to give it a whirl - I expect you won't be disappointed!

24535231.review:
Вообще, выбрать среди новинок хоть что-то подходящее очень трудно, так как щас выходят, о основном только визуальные новеллы да порты с мобилок и увидеть полноценную игру было очень даже приятно. Особенно порадовали скрины с игрой. Игра находится в раннем доступе, потому и понятно, что нормальной производительности ждать не стоит и я извиняюсь за фризы, которые вы будете видеть на экране. 
Так же проблемой является отсутствие русского языка потому что текста в игре довольно много. Это и диалоги и всевозможные записки и свой собственный ЛОР. Потому людям, которым мешает языковой барьер придется трудно. Играть мы будем за мышь-музыканта Тило, и сразу хоччу сказать что это один из милейших персонажей в видеоиграх.
Геймплей - это смесь рпг-элементов и стэлса, сражаться наш герой не способен, потому приходится прятаться везде где только можна - в корзинах, шкафах и ящиках. Врагами на первых порах будут здоровенные крысы от которых не очень трудно скрыться. Также в ходе прохождения нужно решать некторые головоломки.
Графика выглядит очень красиво, Тило да и другие персонажи прорисованы очень хорошо, локациизаполнены всякими мелкими деталями с которыми еще и можно взаимодействовать. Так, мы можем подбирать еду, двигать объекты по всем законам физики. А иногда потребуется и стул поднести для того чтобы добраться до расположенного на высоте предмета.
 А Тило, между прочим, двойным прыжком не владеет. 
Учитывая что игра находится в раннем доступе, не имеет поддержку русского рекомендовать ее трудно. С другой стороны, игры в таком сеттинге я еще не встречал. Мне скриншоты сразу напомнили книги и мультсериал об аббадстве "Рэдволл", мир которого очень напоминает тот, который показан в игре.

24534043.review:
[h1]为什么我会花钱买这款游戏[/h1]
实际上，在我写下这篇测评前，我甚至都没打开游戏（正在下载中）。所以看到这篇测评的朋友可能会怀疑这篇测评是否有参考价值。为什么我会花钱买这款游戏？又是什么原因让我在没有玩过这款游戏就为它写下这篇测评呢？

一个很重要的原因是我习惯性地点开了这款游戏在商店页面右下方“官方网站”，在里面我看到这样一段开发者的描述
[quote=Why should I buy the game now instead of waiting for the final version?] 	
That’s a fair question and the answer revolves around money: there’s none left.

Successful games’ crowdfunding campaigns can reach a few hundred thousand dollars, sometimes even close to a million. The campaign for GoaT brought roughly $40K of effective budget.

As some of you know I’ve been working on Ghost of a Tale each and every day of my life for the last three years and I’ve paid myself $500 per month. The rest of the money went to buy hardware, licenses and of course to compensate my collaborators.

Note that I’m not complaining at all; no-one is forcing me to create Ghost of a Tale!

Now we could very well start a new crowdfunding campaign but it would require quite a lot of time and energy and it would push back the game by as much. I prefer to put that effort into development. And given the advanced state of Ghost of a Tale I think the early access route is the best for everyone.

That being said I totally respect players who would rather play the game when it’s finished and prefer to wait for the final version to be released.

If however you choose to buy the pre-release version, know that you are actually making the development of Ghost of a Tale possible. Plus you get a better price while the game is still in early access since the final version will likely be more expensive when it’s out.
[/quote]

简单的概括一下就是：
[olist]
[*]开发者为这个游戏花了3年时间，没日没夜地全情投入到游戏的开发中，这期间他依靠自己的积蓄平均每月投入500美元，整整3年时间。

[*]他原本有一个更好的融资机会，但是那样会让他没法将全部精力都放到这款游戏的开发中，他在钱和保证游戏品质之间做了选择，最后他放弃了那个融资机会。

[*]之所以现在把早期版本上架出售，开发者很明确的回答提问的人：因为他已经没有足够的钱在支撑下去了。他将早期版本发售是想通过STEAM和GOG这样的平台来吸收后续开发所需的资金，这部分资金用来购买设备继续完成这部作品。

[*]相对与之前的融资机会，将早期版本预先发售换取后续开发资金的方式，显然要“轻松”的多。这里的轻松指的是他不需要分散过多的精力到和投资者寒暄、谈判。他可以继续全情投入到游戏开发中。[/olist]

看到这里，我非常认可开发者的真诚和直率，同时也很钦佩他对这款游戏的热情和执著。我觉得作为一个热爱游戏的玩家，有必要用实际行动来支持一下这位有“梦想”的开发者，而且，这款游戏看上去也非常吸引人。

================================================================
[h1][7.30 更新]谈谈游戏的体验[/h1]
必须得承认这是一款很棒的游戏，游戏整体烘托出来的紧张刺激氛围很容易让人沉浸其中。随着不断地探索，我意外地发现这款游戏融合了很多时下流行的元素，比如：
[list]
[*]主线任务和支线任务的加入让这款游戏有了点RPG游戏的味道
[*]搜集元素和套装系统的加入又让这款游戏有了点沙盒游戏的味道
[*]核心的解谜环节难度适中，而最大乐趣在于你可以选择“适合”自己的方式来达成目标。
[*]不会看到血腥的内容，没有暴力的杀戮，取而代之得是需要更多的开动脑筋，这意味着它很适合拿来和孩子或女朋友一起玩。
[*]据开发者透露目前EA版本只呈现了完整版的25% - 30%的内容，但经过10个小时的游戏之后，个人认为目前暂时放出的游戏内容还是非常丰富的。
[/list]

[h1]购买建议[/h1]
对于中文语境下的玩家来说，在现阶未加入中文语言的情况下啃起来会有些许得吃力。原因在于这款游戏的内容很丰富，文字量也很大，我几乎是靠着翻译软件和游戏截图来进行游戏。所以，如果你不是一位有耐心的玩家，又对自己英语能力持怀疑态度的话，我建议暂时观望。

24530385.review:
Oh man oh man oh man is this game good, the moment I saw it I knew it sparked my interest but and I just HAD to buy it, but the moment I started it up was when I was really amazed.

 Graphically the game is actually pretty beautiful and runs pretty smoothly for the most part. Story wise you basically wake up as a mouse in a prison and though travelling though the world you find out a bit more about the world around him...i'm mostly being vague about this because I want other people to discover the world though fresh eyes as I did and was pleasently suprised. Little things like having to use a light or a lantern to see dark areas, a day and night cycle, and beautiful visuals go a long way here.

 Story wise, the game is up there as I stated before I don't want to give too much away but the writing is actually pretty well done, with a good amount of lore for the world and I love how there's little notes anytime something is mentioned and should you want to know more about it, you push a button and a small bit of information on whatever it is comes up to help you understand. But that's not all, there's also the characters who for the most part fit their molds pretty well, keep in mind i've only played for about 4 hours and met a handful of the characters but all of them played their parts well enough ranging from mysterious, stoic, and even funny when it comes to two certain characters.

Gameplay wise, the game is pretty smooth, the controller set up is easy enough to get used to...i'm playing with a X1 controller so maybe you may have a different experince but for me personally I loved it, I love how you FEEL like a mouse as you play, the way your mouse stands, crawls around, and even weaves between enemies, small cracks, and more only serves to immerse you more in the world. Hell you literally have to use a little foot stool to get to open up taller cabinets and what not due to your miniture size, I'm sure for some people this may be a bit annoying but for me personally it only serves to hammer the fact that you're basically just a small ordinary (but adorable) mouse.

THATS NOT ALL FOR GAMEPLAY! There's alot little bit of somewhat light RPG elements where you can find little parts of costumes like a pirate, theif, or armor suits and if should you find all the pieces it gives you a lovely major stat bonus, even though using the costumes' individual parts do give you points...oh yeah...also....characters literally comment on what you're wearing or what time of the day it is, once again to some people that may be lame but for me that shows a lot of care and effort put into this game, espcially considering most RPG's or something where you can be dressed like a dork and basically still be taken serious, or go into someone's house at 3AM and still have a normal conversation...NOPE not in this game, I was told to take off my hat before talking to a character because it represented something he didn't respect, I was also told to come back in the morning due to one of the  quest givers being alseep.

Look, we both know how Early Access goes, you buy it early, then you hope the devs update it often, but ultimately you know you're going to be getting some kind of junky product and still play with the raw state of the game....but let me tell you this game feel so good, i've been playing for 4 hours and I still find myself running all around the same places discovering little costume pieces I didn't find, or just juking guards until i decide to do some more quest.

(Nothing funner than running around in circles around a guard and locking him in a room)

As you can tell, I really like this game, I'm glad it turned out good for an early access game, what the devs have here is something magical and meaningful, I can only hope th at the devs listen to fan feedback when it comes to bugs, but give as much love, care, and detail to every bit of the game that i've experienced so far, and are unshaking in their commitment to releasing a quality game.

24527453.review:
This game was one that I have been hoping would be as good as the trailer hinted at. It as not, in fact it was far better. After six and a half hours, I've a few thoughts.

What I expected was a pretty and gorgeous looking game and indeed it is that (my graphics card cried, but they are tears of happiness!). The motion blur feels well at home the animations of characters are smooth, expressive and in Tilo's case often adorable, and the surroundings are a breath of fresh air. In some ways I'm reminded of the painting-quality graphics you saw in point and click games or yore, yet fully rendered and animated wonderfully in 3D

What I did not expect was the depth of the game itself. Each character feels different and you can understand them easily, in short they make sense (sometimes in their very quirky way, you fellow players know who I'm talking about~!). Throwaway comments often turn out to be interesting and important lore issues that thread into other characters and the storyline itself. I've heard mentions of several other places, with background and information attached, which makes me feel like I may actually end up playing there someday (If I ever stop skittering around this jail!). You can clearly feel the differences in personality in the species, and within each species the range of people there also. It can be subtle, and it can be noticeable, but it feels right. Some friendly characters I'd trust with, some I'd like to trust and some I'm a bit weary of. Then there's the one or two I'd not trust as far as Tilo can't throw them!

when I first started playing this game, I was almost expecting a skyrim-level attention to detail with dungeons, specifically where you start. One small pass through, find interesting elements, move on. Boy was I wrong!  I've gone through the Jail nearly forty times, and each time I've spotted something I've missed, something obvious that I simply didn't expect or think about. Often times it's something plot-important that, as you would expect considering what it is, I simply overlooked. And when I find it, either my chance or by being told, it feels natural. 

All in all, I can't recommend this game enough. I've seen a lot of people say it makes them think of Dark Souls with a mouse. I can see where they care coming from, but I'd like to counter. With the details of the game down even to statistics Tilo has with different items equipped, I would say this is more the perfect mix of point and click, Tabletop RPG, and then yes, Dark Souls. It throws you into the game, is forbidding and tricky, but Ghost of a Tale is forgiving when you mess up, as long as you think like a mouse!

I think I may be addicted, really can't wait to see what's beyond the walls of this jail!

24527195.review:
Just saw this game in the Store, and fell instantly in love with it. Couldn't play too much, since it's almost midnight and I have to work tomorrow, but I want to leave a mark on the rating of the game, so here's a glimpse at what I saw in one hour spent with the game.

In short, the game is cute as f*** without being childish. I'm not too far in, so currently I can't say for sure if it was worth the price, but I recon that it was. So far it looks like a "Thief light" game without fighting; the protagonist mouse must sneak his way past enemies to find and rescue his wife, while completing various other quests, and then - judging from the "intro", a few words about a world changing event - he saves the world. Or not, that remains to be seen.

The graphics are solid; the screenshots tell the truth so if you find them appealing then you won't be disappointed. The characters are well done, the hero is maybe the cutest looking one this side of a children's game, the rat guards are cartoonishly menacing in their steel armor, and the frog pirate prisoner is... well, also cute as an antropomorph frog can be. Since this is also an XBox game there are not too many graphic options, but there are more than your average console port tends to have; you can toggle on/off a few effects and set the draw distance for shadows and lights. The framerate is solid for me on everything set to max, but I play on an R9 290X, so I assume I could provide relevant info about this if I have experienced slowdowns. Well, I haven't, so there's that. One thing to note: I have a 16:10 monitor and the resolution can not be set to 1680x1050, but there is an 1600x900 option, which will leave a thin black border on the top and bottom of the screen which does not refresh, so elements of the Steam overlay for example will "freeze" there. I don't mind it too much, but who knows what others will think.

Music is only in the main menu so far - a pleasant tune, starting out a bit sad, but getting more adventurous later -, but our mouse is a minstrel so that may change further in the game. As for the sound effects, they seem alright and fitting; the game starts in a prison and I haven't escaped yet, so I wouldn't give a final verdict on this either.

The controls are good, perfectly playable so far with mouse and keyboard, with invertable X and Y axis, and the game supports controllers. What a surprise, it's also on XBox. I must note that at some point in the beginning a tutorial pop-up tells you how to un/equip stuff and it shows the buttons on a controller, not the keyboard, but you can do this from the inventory too, so not a big deal. Other controls are configurable from the menu.

There are bugs, but it's still in EA, and in one hour I couldn't find anything gamebreaking. Once I was stuck for a few moments in an open doorway while sneaking, but that resolved itself without reloading. The list of things to say in a conversation can not be scrolled with the wheel on the mouse (other windows can be), but there's the slider on the side, so it's not a biggie either. Ah, scrolling. During conversation the footnotes (you'll know it when you see it) can turn up empty, but trying to scroll or click inside them should reveal the text. And just to be a jerk, I have to mention that I saw spelling errors/missing words here and there.

Another thing I think worth mentioning. Nowadays it is a custom in games where you have to pick up stuff to make these items glow, or stand out in some other way. Here you only get the item's name pop up when you're close enough and facing the item. I'm an older gamer so I'm used to no hand-holding, but maybe it would bother others. And before I forget: looting chests can be dangerous because I found one with a hornet's nest inside. Interestingly enough the hornets were kind enough to hurt me only when I looked into the chest, but left me alone when I actually hid in it from a rat guard...

All in all this seems to be a superb game with a great atmosphere, cute characters, quests to do and stuff to find. What else do you need?

24525586.review:
Очень милая игра в жанре приключения/стелс с элементами рпг. Главный герой - мышонок Тило (анимация и моделька гравного героя - ка ки всех остальных персонажей - выше всяких похвал) ищет всою супругу в застенках мрачного замка. Как я понял, прокачки и сражений тут нет (Тило размером в два раза меньше чем противники-крысы), зато присутствует огромный инвентарь, ну и мышонок для своего размера высоко прыгает, умеет перносить тяжелые предметы, а сохранится можно только в режиме hide (т.е. спрятавшись в каком-нибудь сундуке или корзине).
За игрой следил с момента начала разработки (бейкером не был), и уже не ждал, что ее выпустят - с момента краудфайндинговой компании прошло года четыре.
На данный момент враги временами застревают в стенах, временами вываливаются текстуры, странно ведут себя крысы, когда ловят Тило (мышонок валится на землю мертвым, а крыса продолжает сжимать воздух) и игра немного подтормаживает (на GTX 970), думаю, что это пофиксят со временм (на то и ранний доступ). Доступны не все разрешения экрана (мой рабочий режим 1680х1050, например, не обнаружен в списке доступных).
Я не большой поклонник стелса (особенно вспоминая недавний Shadwen), но в эту игру приятно играть.

这是个画风稍微黑暗，但是设定比较有意思的游戏。
我们的主角，不知道因为啥被抓进了监狱，然后有一天，你的朋友？（大概吧），给了你一个机会逃出监狱，然后我们的主角就开始了冒险之路。
好的简单的说下这个游戏。
画面比较精美，带有解密以及潜行的元素，这游戏很友善的不是那种被发现就完蛋的，你可以通过你风骚的走位来绕过警卫的攻击。
这个游戏存在些小细节，当主角爬一些高台时会有一个爬上去的动作，地上的小虫会被你惊扰到远离你，守卫抓住你的时候会把你高高举起，然后被烧死。。然后被烧死。。然后被烧死。。别问我为啥说了三遍。游戏也有一些收集要素。
接下来是游戏性上，操作手感不错，不过如果不勾鼠标上下视觉控制颠倒的话可能大多数玩家不会这么容易适应向上移鼠标向下看这种操作。少许的解密元素不太难，警卫们都是小聋瞎。游戏除了正常的按进度保存，就是躲进可以躲藏的东西里面保存，后者是常用的保存方法，防止意外翻车。
因为只是稍微的玩了会，所以并没有很详细的介绍。
评分 9/10  为啥要推荐这个游戏呢？因为这个游戏值得推荐。

24523839.review:
After just over an hour with the early access, I am completely enchanted by this game, right from the moment ""Save Early, Save Often" - An Old Mouse Proverb" came up during a loading screen.

And that's one of the major things that really stood out to me so far is just how well written it is, full of wit, charm and genuine laughs. Not bad considering there's no voice acting. 

The care for the writing extends naturally to everything else, the game is littered with wonderful details; from the wonderful little jaunt in the protagonists animations to the numerous items cluttering the world, all with descriptions and lore. There's a definitive whiff of Dark Souls about all of it so far, gloomy dungeons and intricate world design but despite the game's genuine thrill of exploration it's no dungeon crawler. This is a colourful stealth game and light puzzler, full of tense evasion and no combat to speak of. You outwit or evade your foes, with a variety of tools and here, Ghost of a Tale takes on a life of its own.

It's also just an utterly gorgeous game, even at this stage, with lovingly lit dungeons and fantastic sense of character.

Besides, if absolutely nothing else, this is a game where you can as a mouse in a pirate costume, eye patch and all. What's not to love?

40987273.review:
Ghost of a Tale is an adventure/stealth game in a world ruled by rats. However, you do not play a rat, but rather a minstrel named Tilo who has been imprisioned for sedition because his wife refused to dance for the Baron. When you awaken in your cell, you discovere under some stale bread, a key and a note from a benefactor somewhere in the keep who needs you assistance. In avoiding detection you find your benefactor, and from here you embark on your journey though Dwindling Heights (Formerly known as Duinlane Heights) in a quest to find your beloved Merra. 

Now, before you jump into this wonderfully rendered game, you will need to read some of the ingame books in order to understand the circumstances of the characters in the game. You need to READ AND COMPREHEND. If you don't, you won't understand what others are wanting from you. Some outfits also have social modifiers to them, wich you can learn about by reading the entries on them, the most obvious is that dressed in the armor, you appear like a scrawny rat, as as such, can move about in the game, unchallenged. 

While the game has been finaly released in March of 2018, it is still a little buggy. Sometimes you are unable so get out of hiding places, other times you are unable to pick up certain items, and if you find yourself in too tight of a spot, the camera will glitch out. Most of these glitches are easily remedied with a restart, or simply moving Tilo to another place.

Another thing to know is that there is no real combat in this game. Sure, you can indirectly kill spides, or knock out a rat or two, but if you think you're going in with a sword, you got another thing comming. It's a stealth game, and apparently, in this game, mice aren't exactly know for their courage.

My first complete play-thru after release took about 16 hours to complete. This is because early reliance of the full suit of armor (needed to disguise yourself as a really small rat), is heavy, and requires modifications to allow you to move quickly. This can be done by focusing on the quests assigned to you from the Commander. Also, finding keys is important too, as most of the shortcuts in the game are locked or not too terribly obvious. You don't need to do all the quests in the game to finish it, but doing quests will give you benefits, such as special pieces of clothing, or as I previously mentioned, modifications to the armor.

There is also leveling in this game, but this is mostly tied to your health. The higher your levels, the more health you have, thus are a little more durable in case you fing yourself discovered by a very unfriendly rat that would like to pound you flat.

And lastly, while this is a complete game, it seems like this game is the start of a larger saga, as at the end, Tilo sails away to find his wife who is supposedly on the Isle of Periclave. I look forward to it's sequal.

40985284.review:
首先感谢[url=steamcommunity.com/groups/17173firefly] 17173萤火虫	[/url]提供的游戏key

[h1] 【游戏简介】	[/h1] 
《精灵鼠传说》是一款以老鼠视角的第三人称动作冒险解密独立游戏，玩家将扮演萌萌的小耗子在充满中世纪建筑风格的开阔世界里展开冒险。

[h1] 【故事背景】	[/h1] 
小老鼠Tilo擅长演奏音乐，与妻子过着幸福的生活。（后面任务对话中能推出还有个孩子）在某次为男爵演奏曲子的时候，出于某种原因Tilo的妻子Merra被男爵掠走，自己被囚禁在牢狱里。数日子过去了，Tilo在梦中喊着Merra的名字从梦中醒来，他坚信自己的妻子Merra还活着，开始了自己的寻妻之旅。

[h1] 【初感受】[/h1] 
在冷冰冰，充满危险的世界里，超萌的小耗子瞬间就化解了周围的气氛，拥有着一双大大萌萌的眼睛，一对充满灵性的耳朵，有时还会做些可爱萌呆的小动作来逗玩家开心，配合着在城堡顶端俯瞰的风景，真的超治愈！

[h1] 【游戏特色】[/h1] 

 [b] ①出色的画面视听表现	[/b] 
不论是夜晚还是白天，游戏制作者都很贴切地自然地表现出了当时的动静结合美，细腻的画面，恰到好处的光影效果，伴随着Tilo轻快的脚步声，仿佛身临其境，那种感觉久久不能忘怀，你甚至能玩出步行模拟器的感觉，心情好的时候，在风景好的地方随手截个图都能当壁纸。

 [b] ②丰富有趣的换装系统	[/b] 
在游戏里面我们能够收集到很多不同的套装（吟游诗人/守卫/漫游者/盗贼/海盗/国王），不同的套装有着不同的属性与特色，比如守卫可以伪装，不会被敌人察觉，偷手巾偷钥匙什么的易如反掌。盗贼更不易被人发现，脚步更轻等。不过收集套装是个很考验耐心的事情，为了我们的Tilo能穿上更多实用又好看的衣服努力地收集吧。

 [b] ③形形色色的支线任务	[/b] 
游戏除了主线任务外还加入了大量又不失乐趣的支线任务，支线任务的完成不仅能获得丰富的经验，更能熟知整个故事剧情，了解到更多新奇的事情。比如牢狱中青蛙一开始并不知道自己的船长已经死了等。[spoiler] 游戏中有的人物对话还加入了音乐弹奏，根据不同人物说话内容选择适合的曲子弹奏，选对还能获得高额经验奖励。	[/spoiler]

 [b]④会心一笑的细节表现	[/b] 
细节能突出一款游戏是否足够优秀，能在主要流程不失精彩的基础上把握好细节的表现，我们的《精灵鼠传说》做到了。比如当你长时间不操作小耗子Tilo的时候，它便会在原地做各种有趣的动作，捡东西的时候耳朵的自然扇动，从高处跌落根据高度的不同，最终摔倒的姿势也各不相同（心疼我们的小耗子Tilo），躲避敌人用的柜子，床，桌子，棺材等的不同，偷窥的视线也各有差异等，提倡玩家亲身游玩，亲自体会吧。

 [b] ⑤昼夜循环系统	[/b] 
游戏加入了昼夜循环，有些任务需要白天才能触发，有些任务需要晚上才能去探索，白天在室外的视野更明亮，方便我们外出探索，夜晚视线则昏暗许多，只有借助油灯才能看清楚道路（更重要的是白天和夜晚的风景完全不一样），这一系统的加入无疑延长了游戏探索时间（很贴心的是我们可以找到床铺，通过睡觉来改变当前的游戏时间），完善了游戏体验，丰富了游戏内容。

 [b] ⑥多样的游玩方式	[/b] 
许多时候当要达到一个目的的时候，我们通常会考虑多个方案，经过深思熟虑后选择最佳方案作出决定。我们的小老鼠Tilo也不例外，比如当你需要守卫的钥匙时，你可以偷，也可以击晕了明抢（游戏中不能击杀任何大型敌人，只能通过击晕造成短时间的昏迷），在取得守卫套装进行伪装后直接拿都是可以的。又或是当你被守卫发现后，你可以选择找一个安全的地方躲着，也可以是通过风骚的走位秀它们一路，不过敌人的智商有限，一般追出一定距离就自动放弃追捕了。[spoiler] （不能在其他角色面前换装这一点设计很好，一点也不违和）	[/spoiler]

[h1] 【核心要素】	[/h1] 
 [b] ①钥匙	[/b] 
游戏初期很多房间由于没有钥匙是进不去的，然而钥匙的分布也各不相同，有的需要通过任务获取，有的需要场景物品互动，有的需要去守卫处拿。因此钥匙成了推动主线的至关重要的道具。
[b] ②地图 	[/b] 
游戏丰富的内容铸就了复杂的地图布局，对于路痴来说，地图就成了必不可少的道具。不同区域都有对应的地图，都是需要通过探索拿去，如果你没那个耐心，也可以通过花点金币去铁匠处直接购买。
[b] ③道具 	[/b] 
包括各种投掷物，像是树枝（一般用来触发陷阱或者机关），酒瓶（一般用来击晕无头盔的低级守卫或者打蜂巢），黏液瓶（一般用来砸有偷窥高级守卫的腿），松果（用来封住大蜈蚣的口子，效果惊人），蜡烛，油灯（点燃物品或者照明使用）,各种食物（恢复生命）等。
 [b] ④书本	[/b] 
记录着各种各样的内容，包括对于剧情外其他内容的额外补充，谜题线索，套装信息，曲谱等。
 [b] ⑤技能	[/b] 
通过经验升级提升能力外，还能从两盗贼处学习到多种实用的技能，包括扩充物品携带上限，高处跌落缓冲，发现可互动物品，更快感知敌人的能力等。
 [b] ⑥任务	[/b] 
记录各种未完成，已完成任务，包括任务内容，提示等，随时可供查阅。

[h1] 【游玩感受】	[/h1] 
游戏的乐趣除了收集探索外，各种任务剧情对话也很有意思。游戏中有多处让我印象深刻，比如在高塔帮助sail拿一只甲虫，却不小心放走了其他所有的甲虫，sail回头问tilo有没有发生什么情况，这里选项可以选择老实回答和隐瞒，我选择的是老实承认。没想到sail说她知道，只是测验看tilo是否会自己承认。又比如最开始帮助青蛙后，tilo拿走了他桶里的所有东西，后来回来问到下水道钥匙的时候，他告诉tilo去桶里拿的时候，tilo很是郁闷当初不是全拿光了，里面并没有下水道钥匙，青蛙却不屑地回答到：哦，现在在了。以及后面偷取sail的望远镜给予别人后，回头会被sail问到要帮她拿回来，甚至你擅自拿了sail的东西后，不还给sail，她便生气不帮tilo了。

[b] （点赞项）	[/b] 
 [b] ①独特的存档点	[/b] 
必须要在柜子，箱子等可躲避的物品内才可以存档，类似安全屋的性质。
 [b] ②即将推出的中文	[/b] 
游戏内容丰富，虽然英文单词不难，但是文本量也不小，对于想深入了解剧情的人来说，汉化再好不过，官方也承诺后面会更新中文，一起期待吧。
 [b] ③贴心的提示	[/b] 
任务太难，不知道接下来做什么怎么办，收集太多，不知道何从下手怎么办等，你需要出牢狱小门左转，高个子老鼠铁匠了解一下？不想动脑，那么付钱换提示吧[spoiler] （厨房有个赌徒可以快速赚钱，检验血统的时候到了）。	[/spoiler]
 [b] ④超赞的游戏美工	[/b] 
也许很多玩家是为了看tilo才购买的游戏吧，对于tilo的形象，一个字萌，两个字真萌，三个真™萌。

[b] （改进项）	[/b] 
 [b] ①音乐单调	[/b] 
能听到的BGM很少，而且还是只有触发特殊对话内容或者被敌人发现后才能听到。
 [b] ②Bug不少	[/b] 
鬼畜，浮空，卡地图等都不少出现过。[spoiler]（从指挥官楼顶可以直接穿到高塔部分）		[/spoiler]
 [b] ③敌人智商偏低 	[/b] 
对于走位就能轻松逃脱的潜行来说，少了一种味道，加上后期伪装，难度就更低了。

[h1] 【总结】	[/h1] 
这么萌的人设，这么优秀的画面，这么丰富的游戏内容，有什么理由错过这么一款独立神作呢？
无论你是喜欢体验轻松幽默的剧情，还是喜欢贼不走空的酸爽，亦或是单纯喜欢欣赏风景，我都推荐你玩玩《精灵鼠传说》，你都能在游戏中找到乐趣，它一定不会让你失望的。
为Tilo打Call！为制作组点赞！感谢你们的付出，带给我们这么一款轻松治愈的游戏。

40985001.review:
Where to start, I don't ever write reviews, but for this game, I'll make an exception. 

I was pointed in it's direction by one of my viewers, checked the store page, my instant reaction being 'zomg mouse rpg' which swiftly followed my partner noticing and announcing that 'I MUST STREAM THIS GAME' well I couldn't be happier that I did, it was wonderful to play, bar the odd bug here and there, getting stuck on stuff that I really shouldn't.. But it is beautiful to look at and relatively easy to play and oh so very cute. Tilo is the greatest mouse (sorry Mickey) to date. 

I loved the fact that quests weren't marked on the map, that you have to find maps or buy them with currency you find, even then still no quest marker, so pay attention and actually read the dialogue or journal. 

Literally the only negative I can say about the game is that it wasn't long enough, I've finished the game twice now (roughly 8 hours per playthrough) although my third playthrough i'll actually try to unlock all the achievements I suppose, any excuse to come back and play again.

Some voice acting would've made this game utterly amazing imo.

10/10.

40984648.review:
Un petit jeux vraiment très sympa, avec des personnages très attachants. Dommage qu'il n'y aie pas de voix, mais quand on sait que ce jeux a été fait par 3 ou 4 personnes avec très peu de moyens on se dit que certains gros studio pourraient en prendre de la graine !
Franchement, pour son prix n'hésitez pas une seconde, foncez, vous ne serez pas déçu !!!

40984492.review:
The first 4-5 hours are great fun!  Then the game becomes a tired mess of back and forth fetch questing for keys and other items that are too hard to find.  The smithy can, for a price, tell you where items are located but the maps are really shit.  I couldn't find the eleveator key and even forum posts about said key didn't help me figure out where the hell it was located.  The shores?  Is that the cliffs?  The faraway tower?  I think all three of those areas are the same area.  Maybe I'm stupid or mayb the game just really lacks a sense of direction.  The smithy can also provide maps to you but for only a handful of areas which would of helped me distinguish between these locations because where area has the same walls, chests, barrels, etc.

Enemies are brain dead and it is very tiring "sneaking" by them (by just running past their poor AI).  90% of your game time will be running through the same halls passing the same guards who take the same routes.  All of the quests are fetch quests and the only thing carryign them is the charm of the characters which only continues so far as you do fetch quests for them.  There's no puzzles to solve and the story randomly involves this ghost spirit from way long ago?  Why?  I liked when the plot was grounded, I was a mouse, awaking in a jail, and had to find my maifu (mouse waifu).  I don't know why the spirit was included because as soon as she enters the story she leaves just as pointlessly.

It really is comfy the first 4-5 hours but by the 8th hour I'm calling it quits and am going to look up the ending.  Also even with the stamina upgrade it drains too fast and takes too long to recover given just how many damn times you have to run back and forth.

EDIT:  Looked up the ending.  Clunky combat puzzle things?  No closure on the missing wife?  More ghost crap?  I mean, I get the game is called "Ghost of a Tale" but if the plot opens with me concerned about my wife then why does the game end without closure on wife?  Instead its some stupid spirit crap that I as a player have no connection to (the game makes no attempt for you to care about this specific lore) and really don't care about.  The game should of just stayed "grounded" in terms of plot.

Ich habe mir vor einigen Tagen die verschiedensten Spiele im Steam-Shop angeschaut und dabei bin ich auf "Ghost of a Tale" gestoßen. Die Bilder & der Trailer des Spieles sahen für mich sehr interresant aus, weshalb ich mich dazu entschied dieses Spiel zu kaufen.

Gameplay etc. :
Ich finde die Story und die ganze Entwicklung während des Spieles sehr nett & interresant. Die ersten 2 bis 3  Stunden fand ich wirklich kompliziert & anstrengend da ich Anfangs noch nicht wusste wie & wo ich verschiedene Gegenstände (Schlüssel etc.) finde. Deshalb fand ich das Gameplay anfangs nicht so toll (lag größenteils an meiner Dummheit^^). Doch nach einigen Stunde hatte ich sehr viel Spaß an diesem Spiel gefunden, da ich die Quests und Abenteuer solangsam besser verstand. Mittlerweile habe ich um die 16 Spielstunden und ich muss sagen das Spiel wird aufkeinen Fall langweilig.

Bewertung:
Wer Spiele mit Rätseln, Aufgaben oder einer schönen Fantasiewelt gerne mag sollte dieses Spiel aufjedenfall mal testen!^^

40971992.review:
Chez nous, il existe une règle d'or :
Si le jeu n'est pas en multi, alors on le pirate.

Sauf que Ghost of a Tale est différent, c'est un jeu fait par une toute petite équipe, financé par très peu d'utilisateurs pour un rendu incroyable et rien que pour ça, je veux, je l'ai payé pour récompenser ma satisfaction.

Au final qu'est-ce que Ghost of a Tale ?
- Un jeu d'infiltration où vous incarnez Tito (ou Tilo je sais pu), le plus mignon des souris du secteur qui cherche à la fois sa femme souris captive et à s'évader d'une prison.
- Des graphismes, oh seigneur, il n'y a que l'arrière train de Jen Selter qui pourrait les égaler
- Des quêtes secondaires qui ont TOUTES leur importance, il n'y a pas un moment où vous devrez cracher sur des équipements à récupérer ou un personnage à aider, sachez le.
- Un univers profond et travaillé digne d'un conte de fée, j'ai été agréablement surpris lors des entrées sur les lieux, personnages etc, alors que je suis du genre à lire en diagonal hahaha

Je dois avoir autour de 15h de jeu si on compte mes aventures dans une version crackée haha

Il y a aussi quelques bugs, mais rien que pour le dévouement des développeurs qui sortent des MaJ tous les jours pour corriger TOUS les bugs du jeu, je suis vraiment content d'avoir dépensé un peu de mon chomage pour acheter Ghost of a Tale haha.

Blague à part, ce jeu est lourd, y a une grenouille pirate qui chie littéralement des clés de cellule.

40970170.review:
Интересная и немного грустная сказка про мыша который ищет свою жену.
Игра сделана отлично с вниманием к деталям и хорошо подаваемой историей мира.
Персонажи из тех с кем контактирует наш мимишный герой каждый со своим характером и историей.
Костюмчики для своего мышонка сделаны просто превосходно и делают героя ещё забавнее.
Локации делались с большим вниманием к деталям и истории этих локации.
Сюжет интересен и забавен, я заинтригован и с нетерпением буду ждать продолжения истории!
Тем кто хочет расслабиться и погрузится в интересную историю, я рекомендую эту игру!

40956109.review:
Ghost of a Tale es un juego de sigilo con elementos de RPG que genuinamente me impresió, desde el mapa unificado sin loading screens al estilo de darksouls, hasta el inteligente y gracioso dialogo de los npcs. Tiene sus problemas el juego, como uno que otro bug o a veces como se convierte en una quest de coleccionar cosas para progresar la historia, pero los pros sobrepasan los contras en mi opinion.

Lo bueno:
+Hermoso art style y animaciones detalladas y hermosas.
+Un solo mapa unificado, una vez que cargas tu partida, no te tomas mas loading screens.
+Personajes e historia interesante y divertida, tiene unos cuantos plot holes, pero es extremadamente disfrutable el juego, el lore es profundo e interesante.
+Gameplay solido, en principio, este es un juego de sigilo, pero al final, si lo decides puede cambiar un poco.
+Los detalles del mundo y el juego, son algo impresionantes, desde las bacinicas debajo de las camas hasta las mariposas volando cuando llegas a espacios abiertos, el nivel de detalle del juego es impresionante.
+UI limpia y ordenada

Lo malo:
-Uno que otro bug, nada grave, pero te sacan de la inmersion del juego.
-Si bien las quest y los npcs son interesantes, lo que haces ingame es mundano.
-Algunos puzzles son muy obscuros.
-La mision final es algo que tiene sentido argumentalmente, pero a nivel de gameplay no es congruente con el resto del juego.
-Esto es algo personal, pero cambiar de trajes es algo molesto, esto es algo muy notable porque lo haces mucho y muy seguido.

¿Lo recomiendo?
Si, pero solo si te gustan los juegos de sigilo y estas dispuesto a jugar un juego sin quest marks y pistas vagas (la mayor parte del tiempo), este no es un juego para todos, lo describo como darksouls sin sistema de combate y con sigilo, si eso te llama la atención, vale cada centavo.

40939872.review:
If I'd been asked to consider or describe a game as "Soulsborne sans combat" a week or two ago, I would have simply been befuddled. Combat is a pretty integral part of that third-person romp through atmospheric lands. Now, however, that sticks in my mind as an accurate, boiled-down description of the gameplay in Ghost of a Tale.

I adore this game.

I've seen some reviews that focus on the stealth aspect, which is not entirely invalid, but that matters less after the first third (or so) of the game, when a disguise allows free movement through previously-guarded areas. There are some puzzles here and there, as well as things to find. That leaves the main thread of gameplay being the heavy emphasis on exploration of areas that interlock and curve back on themselves in ways that are fun to uncover.

The atmosphere is definitely there, it not as bleak and lonely as a Souls game. A nice feature lets you get a pop-up with further details on lore terms as they come up in conversation (rather than needing to dig through menus) and there is a weight of that history hovering over the present, both in setting and characters. I found the handful of major NPCs all game across as very genuine. The player gets insights into the protagonist's history as collectibles are found, but he starts to see some of that through new eyes as well. As Tilo is a mouse minstrel, we also get his book of songs - one that is revised and added to over the course of the story and makes a very nice touch.

Early on, I felt the distinct lack of voice and immediately thought, "Man, this could have been that much better." Looking back after completing the game, however, I'm less sure. That might have been a design/budget decision, but for as much as I wanted voice to start with, I wasn't bothered by the absence by the end. Some of those lines would have been difficult to deliver with the proper emotion and I find myself wondering if filling in the gaps mentally (as one must with a book compared to a movie) might have actually added to the experience.

Technically, I had a few problems along the way. Three or four times, I got Tilo and the camera stuck in a spot for several seconds. There were some occasions of being able to see sky instead of terrain until I moved close enough. I also hit a progress-blocking bug with a quest - thanks to a note on Steam, I was able to email my save file and get a fixed version back in within an hour (on a Sunday). There have been update patches coming out frequently these first few days after release fixing most of the major issues. Given the game was largely developed by one person, I credit the response time more than I blame for the bugs in the first place.

I don't consider it a spoiler (though some might) to say the ending does not wrap everything up. To me, it felt satisfying in the way that a short first novel of a series might. There are revelations and developments. There's a climax. The main threads of the story, however, are still there and the door is wide open for continuation.

And I find myself sincerely hoping it comes.

40931157.review:
Ghost of a tale est une aventure comme on en voit rarement aujourd'hui.
Certains diront que les bugs ternissent l'expérience, et certes, ces petits bugs sont encore en nombre. Pour ma part, ce que je vois c'est que les développeurs font des mises à jour quasi-quotidiennes pour améliorer le jeu et satisfaire les joueurs, qu'ils répondent aux questions et sont à l'écoutent des critiques. Et il me semble que ce n'est pas tous les jours qu'on voit ce genre d'implication de la part de développeurs. Rien que ce point mérite d'être salué.

Du côté du jeu en lui-même, l'univers laisse rêveur, les personnages sont extrêmement attachants, les quêtes sont nombreuses et intéressantes, bref l'immersion est totale. Un jeu fait d'aventures et d'énigmes, un jeu qui ne nous tient pas la main à chaque étape pour laisser une part de mystère. En somme, si vous aimez l'exploration, l'infiltration, les univers fantastiques, si vous en avez assez des jeux où chaque quêtes est tracées et où l'on vous guide constamment, ce jeu est fait pour vous. Et il est parfait, même avec ses petits défauts.
 
Un grand bravo à l'équipe de développement, vous avez fait un super travail, et j'invite toutes les personnes qui hésitent à acheter ce jeu à le faire, parce qu'il est d'une qualité peu commune.

40928347.review:
[h1]OK, ICH HAB MICH VERLIEBT...[/h1]

Ich geb es zu, ich hab mich verliebt. Verliebt in Tilo, verliebt in knuddelige Grafik, verliebt in ein Indie-Game, bei dem man zu jeder Sekunde merkt, dass viel Herzblut in die Entwicklung geflossen ist.

[h1]Die Technik[/h1]
Grafisch ist Ghost of a Tale genau das, was man im Trailer und auf Screenshots sieht. Einfach schön.
Performance is super.
Sound ist super.
Deutsche Übersetzung ist on point!

Spielt sich am besten mit einem Controller! ;)

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Ghost of a Tale entpuppt sich als reines Stealth-Erkundungsgame, mit einer vielzahl an Quests, irre-witzigen Charakteren, einer liebevollen Geschichte und Gefahren an jeder Ecke. Ratten und andere Widersacher werden umgangen, kurzzeitig außer Gefecht gesetzt oder man versteckt sich vor Ihnen. Kämpfen kann Tilo nicht... er ist eine Maus.

Durch das Erledigen von Quests, Verbrennen von Bannern, Erkunden neuer Gebiete, Sammeln von Beute und vielem mehr, erhält man zudem Ruhm, steigt Level auf und verbessert über ein Skillsystem seine Fähigkeiten, Ausdauer und Lebenspunkte.

Werte wie "Sichtbarkeit" etc. verbessert man durch unterschiedlichte, teils unglaublich abgedrehte, Kostüme, die man auf seinen Erkundungen oder das beenden von Quests erhalten kann.
Es gibt einen Kürbishelm...!

[h1]Fazit[/h1]
Wer auf Stealthgames steht, ist hier richtig.
Wer auf knuddelige Mäuse steht, ist hier richtig.
DU bist hier richtig.

[h1]Von mir gibt es einen Mäuse-High-Five![/h1]

Wer einen ehrlichen Eindruck zu Gameplay, Atmosphäre und Sound gewinnen will, schaut einfach mal in mein Let's Play rein:

[b][url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QzT46mwtkNo&list=PL2psCdtfoNCErZZayRFmDlf9XgULrvvHf]Let's Play • Ghost of a Tale[/url][/b]

Ich wünsche - wie immer - viel Spaß beim Zocken! :D

40926368.review:
A very charming game. A lot of love clearly went into the aesthetics and world design, and the characters are well-written and likeable across the board. It's basically an exploration and dialogue-driven adventure game with light stealth elements. Don't expect an action-RPG.

There's some jank and cut corners, as you might expect from a small production like this, but the developers are active in fixing outright bugs. It's not huge in scope, and if you do all the side quests you'll be very familiar with the small, compact game world by the end. Maybe a little too familiar -- there are more fetch/collect quests than I'd like. They're mostly optional, however, and you're usually rewarded with some interesting dialogue or character development.

Довольно двоякие впечатления об игре. До конца я её не прошёл и даже не знаю буду ли играть дальше.
Что понравилась. Ну конечно же главный герой он и милый и забавный, хорошо анимирован. В состоянии покоя то хвост погладит то зад почешет. Графика очень добротная. Есть конечно и более графонистые игры, но здесь она просто хорошая. Также радует глаз когда бегаешь по кустам, большие папоротники забегая в них отодвигаются и возвращаются на место когда отходишь.

Из минусов. Очень неудобно выполнять квесты. Описание самого квеста минимальное, если ты общался с персонажем давшим тебе квест и не вникал в суть беседы то вообще непонятно куда идти. Я не прошу ставить метку на карте "беги туда" хотя и не отказался бы, но детально пояснить где искать квестовый предмет и где потом искать непися принимающего квест просто обязательно.

Итого. Очень атмосферная игра, но плохо описанные квесты убивают всю атмосферу, заставляющие нарезать круги по всем локациям применяя к каждой кочке крохи описания из квеста.

40924408.review:
I can't name a single other game that can match the unbelievable charm of Ghost of a Tale. The stunning art design and graphics, the adorable animations, the fantastic music, the masterful level design, the deep and engrossing lore and worldbuilding, and the unforgettable characters result in one of the most stunningly realized adventures I've had the pleasure to participate in.

This game is simply magical.

Whether you are a fan of the classic animal adventure stories like Redwall, Wind in the Willows, and Disney's Robin Hood, want to spend some time exploring a beautiful seaside fortress, or just want to dress a mouse in adorable little costumes, this game is more than worth it.

[h1]Regarding bugs[/h1]

Please don't be scared off by the possibility of glitches or bugs. Yes, at the moment, it is a little bit buggy, but they are generally very minor things and the vast majority have easy workarounds. In the few instances of players running into more serious issues, you can send your save file to the devs and they will personally fix your individual save file and send it back to you. Where else can you find that kind of customer care and service?

If you need any further convincing, look at the rate of patches. This game has been out for 7 days, and there have been 9 patches. [i]Nine.[/i] That is more than one [i]every day.[/i] By the time I'm done writing this sentence there'll probably be another one. Nowhere can you find a more devoted and hardworking developer.

===================

To end with, I'd like to list a few of my favorite aspects and little details that speak to the incredibly high quality of this product:

[list]
[*]The environment is just unbelievably detailed and un-video-game-like. You know how in even the biggest budget games, in so many cases you will run into blurry textures and flat meshes? There might be incredibly nice-looking foliage, but you can see the ground is a plain flat mesh with a basic texture underneath.

I haven't found a single spot like that in this game. This is possibly the single best usage of tessellation ever: every single pebble sticks out of the ground. Every single brick and rock stick out of the walls with real depth. There are no flat, fake looking or blurry surfaces anywhere in this game. It's an almost surreal experience when you are so used to what a video game "looks like," to suddenly be wandering through something that feels like it is built out of actual real-life objects instead of meshes and textures.

[*]On top of that, the collision and player control are fantastic. Despite the ridiculous three-dimensionality of the world, movement is supremely smooth. I am constantly surprised when, expecting to get stuck bumping into a rock protruding from the ground, Tilo instead scampers right over it. You know, exactly like any game character should, but never does. Other devs, please take note.

[*]Classic platforming is certainly not a major part of the game, but perhaps it should have been, because jumping and climbing is just as smooth and enjoyable as walking and running. I would kill to get a better look at how this works under the hood along with the meshes and colliders on the rocks, because my gosh the way I was able to clamber my way up from the bottom of the utterly natural looking rocky hills in the shore area to the top blew my mind.

[*]Last but not least, foliage. It would be one thing if it was [i]only[/i] some of the most lush and beautiful foliage ever rendered to a screen in real time, which it certainly is. But the interaction just knocks it out of the park. I swear, if all you could do in this game is run through ferns and watch them brush out of the way and then cheerily bounce and snap back into place, it would be worth it.
[/list]

This is what I'm talking about. This obsessive attention to the smallest detail and the dumbfounding sense of presence and place and believability it results in. This world feels real, and I don't want to leave it.

40923465.review:
Muy bueno. Gráficos geniales, artísticamente muy bonito, las animaciones excelentes.

La historia es genial, con todo su trasfondo incluido, el cual da fácilmente para secuelas o spin-offs. El diseño de niveles es más que correcto recordando a una mezcla de Dark Souls y Resident Evil por la interconexión de los niveles y la necesidad de llaves para acceder a algunos sitios.

El juego tiene unos cuantos bugs pero si os fijáis el desarrollador sigue dedicándose en cuerpo y alma a su videojuego sacando uno o dos parches cada día.

Cabe destacar que en el juego no combates, como mucho puedes arrojar objetos para acabar con algunos bichos pero el sigilo es lo primordial en el juego.

La OST está bastante bien. Destaco las canciones que nuestro ratón bardo puede tocar con su laúd. El arte 2D (retratos de los personajes) está hecho por Jerome Jacinto, que también ha trabajado en Armello y Tooth and Tail. Todo un artista.

Si se quiere completar todo el juego puede llevar unas 20 horas aproximadamente, contando los diálogos.

Muy recomendable a los que les gustan las aventuras de exploración con calma pero con algo de tensión también.

40919676.review:
Anyone who knows me would tell you that this game is basically made for me... and not *just* because of the amazingly cute protagonist (though honestly that would have been enough to get me to buy it in and of itself). When I get to play as an amazingly well animated character like that, my enjoyment of a game immediately goes up considerably... yet even with that taken into consideration, I can't recommend this game.

I'm sure this review will get buried beneath the slew of positive reviews with <5 hours of playtime, but for the few folks who actually see this, I hope I can shed some light on the things they aren't telling you.

The art direction in this game? Inspired. It's clear that a huge amount of effort went into creating well-crafted, well-animated art assets and the love that the modelers and artists had for this product shows. It's by far the best thing about the game. The first half or so of the game's world is incredibly well done - detailed, stylized, believable... I was feeling quite fully immersed in this world and its characters and the story. So what changed?

If I had to guess, I'd say the developers got about half way through making this thing and got bored, or ran out of time, or ran out of money, or something, and just scraped the second half together. There are bugs - holy shit are there bugs - and some of them systematically dismantle the experience from its core.

Anyone who only played the first 3-5 hours of the game probably never encountered any of this, and will read this and think I'm crazy for not recommending this game, and if I'd only played 3-5 hours, I'd be right there with them, but once you get to the middle / end of the game, the lack of polish becomes readilly apparent. Holes in the world geometry abound. Leaving the pathways and going to explore the outdoor areas of the game - particularly the 'Shore' area - is just asking to fall through the world. It's clear to me that basically no testing was done in this regard, because you don't even have to try to do it. Luckily, when you fall through the world, the game puts you back on the surface - or, it tries to. All three times this happened to me, the game put me back under the world and created a loop of falling - respawning - falling that forced me to alt+F4 the game and restart it again to continue.

A lot of sounds are just flat out missing. Music exists in some areas and not others, and when you transition between them the music track starts playing in the middle and is quite jarring. There are events that should have sounds associated with them (ringing bells, for instance, or combat happening mere feet from your character) which make no sounds at all. Coincidentally these sounds are primarily missing from the second half of the game - see a theme developing here? No dialog is voiced, and some of it really could have used it. In fact, there's no cutscenes of any kind except the ending which only qualifies by the barest definition of a cutscene, and while the sounds that *do* exist are very well done and really add considerably to the experience, the ones that are missing will pull you out of the game and destroy your immersion.

Speaking of dialog, dialog loops and sequence breaks frequently create nonsensical situations. I'm going to try to be spoiler-free here in case, after reading this, you still want to play this, but there's an encounter near the end of the game wherein a rather monumental event takes place, and a number of guards in the prison the game takes place in watch it happen (or... should, in theory? They were standing literally 10 feet from it...). They then proceed to not react to it in the slightest. This may not sound terribly egregious, and without major story spoilers I can't really illustrate why it is, but trust me when I say that it's completely immersion destroying.

Hopefully you don't just click through the dialog and skip that monumentous story event, but if you do, it's okay - after the event takes place, you can go and talk to an unconcious character and the game will *play the entire event again as if it never happened*, with unconcious characters talking to you, conversation repeating, and those characters getting knocked unconcious again. This is clearly not intended.

The final encounter in the game is the most uninspired, infuriating thing I've experienced in recent memory. Imagine that you're playing Mario, and you're comfortable with the mechanics of Mario and how the game operates, and then in the last level, the game switches to the N64 Superman game. This is the closest approximation of this shit-show that I can make without completely spoiling the story, but but let me assure you that it is utterly ridiculous how contrived it feels. Not only that, but you're required to utilize some objects to complete the encounter. There's about... 8 of them, if I had to estimate, and when you use one, they're consumed. You need to use 3 of them successfully to proceed (why is it always three in these situations? It's like the magic number of gaming bosses.) Here's the rub - if you fail the encounter, and use the 'Load Last Save' prompt that you're given when you do, any of those objects that you used previously *are still gone*. On my third attempt at this steaming pile of an encounter (which I should add is basically a die roll as to whether you can successfully do it, due to a restrictive timer mechanism and utterly unpredictably laughable AI), there were only two of these objects left, and I had to close the game entirely and re-load it to try again.

The ending... well, let it suffice to say that there is no conclusion to the story. It's basically a 'To be continued...', but there's not enough content there for it to conceivably have been a cash grab to promote a sequel... it honestly feels like they got to the end of the game and decided to just not include any real conclusion. In fact, at the end of the game, things are *more nebulous than when it started*, which is kind of a feat in and of itself.

They had a few golden opportunities for branching storylines and a satisfying ending here. There were three scenarios I was speculating would be the end as I was playing, and I was excited to see if my speculation was correct - I would have been better off just not playing the last 20 minutes of the game and writing my own ending, instead. This lack of story wrap-up combined with utterly ridiculous immersion destroying game system choices (dialog is all handled via the game's equivalent of popup boxes, which pause everything else while they're taking place, and the game decides to, while you're being chased by multiple NPCs who're actively trying to kill you, suddenly pull you into a 5-6 line dialog between three characters... on MULTIPLE occasions... in the span of 2-3 minutes, during this ending...) completely ruined the amazing experience that the first 5ish hours of this game brings.

If you feel you must play this game, I wholeheartedly recommend that you stop when you reach the Shore area for the first time. Maybe even the Slopes, because that's where the problems really start becoming apparent. Just stop there, write your own ending in your head, and suffice to say that no matter how ridiculous your version of events is, it will be better than what the team behind this thing actually decided to include.

TL;DR: Bugs. Sequence breaks. Frustrating design choices. Ruined immersion. First 3-5 hours are amazing, one of the best gaming experiences I've had in the past few years. The second half of the game is a smoldering dumpster fire with little hope for redemption. You've been warned.

40916427.review:
En résumé, pour ceux qui ne veulent pas lire toute ma critique, Ghost of a Tale est un jeu terriblement attachant, techniquement impressionnant et à l'univers original et fouillé. Je ne peux que chaudement vous le conseiller !

Explication :
Ce jeu indépendant, créé en majorité par une seule personne, est original sur bien des points, tout en étant très réussi.
Premièrement, l'univers créé par le développeur est unique, riche et très attachant. On sent qu'on entre dans un monde cohérent, intéressant et à nul autre pareil. Le personnage principal, Tilo, est une petite souris ménestrelle (tellement mignonne !!!) qui va essayer de s'échapper de sa prison par ses propres moyens, c'est-à-dire sans aucun affrontement. C'est une grande originalité du titre, vous n'aurez aucun combat à disputer dans GoaT, étant donné que la petite souris n'en mène pas bien large face aux grands rats en armure. Vous devrez donc vous faufilez partout sans vous faire voir.

L'aspect technique et artistique est tout simplement exemplaire. C'est magnifique, les environnements sont fouillés et les animations sont extrêmement travaillées. Honnêtement, je ne me lasse pas de regarder Tilo bouger, sauter ou grimper, tellement c'est bien fait et c'est attachant. Tiens, voilà l'adjectif qui convient bien à ce jeu : attachant !

Pour le gameplay, c'est essentiellement de l'exploration avec une dose d'infiltration (attention, on n'est pas dans du Deus Ex, c'est de l'infiltration gentillette ici, mais très bien faite). Tilo dispose de pas mal de ressources pour se faufiler, tromper certains pnj (en se déguisant notamment) et se sortir de situations dangereuses. Le jeu n'est pas difficile, mais il est suffisamment exigeant pour vous pousser à faire constamment attention.

Enfin, un dernier mot sur les quêtes, les pnj et les dialogues qui sont très soignés, intéressants et pleins de surprises. On sent que ce jeu n'a rien de banal et que de nombreux petits éléments originaux sont disséminés par-ci par-là, et toujours de manière fort réussie.
C'est drôle, prenant, attachant. On passe un super moment sur ce jeu qui vous fait vivre une superbe aventure dans un conte qu'on n'oubliera pas de sitôt.

40910276.review:
Absolute labor of love.

Ghost of a Tale is a wonderfully crafted adventure platforming game which focusses solely on narative, world building and lore.

Graphics are top notch, but it's not the technical aspect in which this games excels but in the design.
It's like you're wandering through the set of a Jim Henson Redwall movie (I seriously wish that were a thing though.)
The level design and interconnectedness  of all areas without any loading screens are a massive bonus, as it adds so much to the believability of this little world. That feeling of traversing an area, looking up or down, recognising an area you have been playing around in for hours and going "ooh, this area is overhere?" is one of the things that drew me to games like Dark Souls and Gothic/Risen.

Game play is, as far as these kind of games go, wonderfully executed, even though all missions can be downplayed as 'fetch' quests, it's the narrative and lore you get as a reward that make it all worth it.
The game can easily be ran through alerting all guards (which has little consequence besides achievements), or played Thief style, sneaking around, swapping costumes and distracting guards by throwing around stick and bottles.
Also, having absolutely zero combat, is a nice change for once.

The music is wonderful, yet doesn't always work in the areas it play.
As for sound (and music), it seems that either it is still very buggy, or there simply was no time spend implementing most sounds, as vast amounts of actions (cutscenes, elevators, hatches, etc) simply lack any sound.
The sounds that are there do their job well enough (not much sound design you can do when it comes to opening steel caged doors or throwing items.)

The pacing might be slow for some people though, especially for those that have little patience and can't be bothered to collect the costumes that make traversal less obnoxious (in the sense of getting detected or stamina regeneration.)

All in all, having played the beta multiple times and finally finishing the final game, I'm left with wanting more as the world is so lovingly crafted and I want to learn more about it and Tilo's role in it.

Despite being a 'fetch' quest adventure game, a big thumbs up, loved every minute of it.

40909736.review: На первый взгляд простая игра, по прошествии нескольких часов, внезапно оказалась очень проработанноый и глубокой. Интересный лор, запоминающиеся герои и их истории. Все приправлено отличной картинкой и звуковым сопровождением. Шедевром ее не назвать, но проектом, сделанным с душой и любовью - несомненно. Это чувствуется, когда все больше и больше погружаешься в игру, говоря себе ну еще 5 минут.

40909538.review:
Anyone who remembers (and likes) the Redwall series of books will feel themselves very much at home in this game's universe.  It's kind of Redwall with a dash of Secret of NIMH -- especailly the final battle looks like something out of the NIMH movie.

Overall, I really enjoyed it.  Some folks claim that it's a scavenger hunt game with a lot of back and forth.  Yes, it is that; however, what makes it tolerable, is there's a lot of shortcuts and different ways to get from point A to point B.  The maps are laid out in a reasonably logical way such that it is rare where you find yourself going, "ARGH, I have to go all the way back there?!"

The varied paths between different points allowed me to get around efficiently and to not be overly bored. The complaint some have about sneaking past the same guard 10 times?  That problem goes away when you get the guard armor. amd that happens fairly early on.  I have a really low tolerance for repetitive stuff and having to wait around to sneak past NPC's and I made it through this game, so unless you have absolutely no tolerance for it, I'd say its worth a shot.

You will encounter bugs.  There were times where I got stuck in something and couldn't get out.  I fell through the world on a few occasions.  It's really kind of unpolished and the camera will often go outside the world.  The end game sequence, the camera bobs in and out of the world really stupidly.  That being said, none of the bugs were major frustrations -- just save every chance you get. They seem very pro-active in fixing things.

On the whole, I think if  you enjoy a game that's more about exploration than combat, with a good story, and a Redwall/NIMH-esq world... give it a try, I think it's totally worth it.

40909202.review:
Pros:
 1. Visuals - This game looks incredible: character design, setting, effects, everything. There are some world tears every once inwhile, as in holes in the grounds, but other then that I don't really have any gripes about visuals. 
 2. Dialogue - Dialogue between main characters is charming. Most of the guards have the same things to say to you most of the time, so that can get repetitive. 
 3. Soundtrack - It's pretty good. I like how they incorporated the mouses profession (a bard basically) into the game.

Cons:
 1. BUGS - This. game. is. RIDDLED. with. bugs. I understand that this team is very small, but the game has been in development for awhile and it's had plenty of testing. I don't see how so many game breaking bugs can still be in this game. Here's a short list of the most annoying bugs i encountered (and this definitly isn't all of them):
       a. My start button on my controller would not work for 3/4 of the game. I tested it on my PS4 
           and the start button works fine, it's the game.
       b. You can pay a guy to show items of interest on your map, but they don't show up half the 
            time. You have to restart  the game for those items to show up, and trust me, it's almost 
            impossible to find some items unless they are marked.
       c. Sounds don't play sometimes or abruptly turn on.
       d. Some quests don't even work. For instance, there's a part where you have to shut 
           someone up because they are wistling to loud. First, you don't hear any wistling (issue from 
           c), but I knew who I had to shut up, or so I thought. When I went to the guy, he just told me 
            to fuck off. After spending 1 hour trying to find the guy I'm supposed to tell to tell to shut 
           up, I end up raging and shutting the game off. I come back and the original guy I thought I 
           was supposed to talk to suddenly wants to talk to me. That was fun... There's many more 
           but I'll stop there.
 2. Story - The story was meh. All the bugs and glitches pretty much took me away from the story 
                 so didn't feel very involved.
 3. Gameplay - I see people praising this game for being a true stealthy game. I'm here to tell 
                        you that that is not true. Maybe the first fourth of the game is like that, but once you 
                        get a set of armour that makes guards ignore you, there's no more stealth. The 
                        only time I felt like this was a stealth game and was actually scared of the rats was 
                        in the beginning. After that, there are no more consiquences. The rats are slow and 
                        easy to out run. Some enemies you actually have to fight and all you can do is 
                        throw shit at them. If you don't have the right thing to throw at them, tough shit. 
                        There's a lot of running back and fourth. There's a total of 7? places I believe, but 
                        you'll be spending most of your time in 2 of them.
 4. Ending - Shit. Boring. Why? Fuck you.

Verdict: 5/10. I really wanted to like this game, but the bugs just made it unbearable. Seeing all these great reviews confuses me because it makes me feel like either I'm the only one getting all these bugs or these people don't give a shit about them. I basically forced myself to finish it because I actually wanted to see how it ended. Without giving any spoilers, It was VERY disapointing. I'd wait to buy it until they fix the bugs.

* formatting fixes

40908335.review:
Мир качественно продуман, Саундтрек хорош, геймплей в целом - тоже. 
Почему в целом? Крысиные доспехи было трудно добыть, и раздражал их огромный вес - персонаж слишком медленно ползал. Карта же практически бесполезна, пока не заплатишь Роло за отметки роз и карт судьбы. Также проблемка со временем: на минуту опоздал к командующему - все, он изволил лечь спать, иди отседа и жди сутки. И снова бежать наверх в башню, к кровати, в этих гребаных тяжелых латах. [spoiler](Внимание, этот текст может быть расценен как спойлер! Небольшой, но все же...) Зато очень командующий очень обрадовал, когда выдал приказ об подгонке доспехов. Но тут опять облом - Роло либо расскажет тебе о ловушках, либо заберет доспехи на 6 часов и вернет уже более легкие.[/spoiler]. 40908029.review:
Ghost of a Tale - штучный продукт в наш век сиквелов, "сырых" игр (привет, Kingdom Come: Deliverance), и бесконечных лутбоксов. 
Да, разработчики собирали деньги на Kikstarter'е. Но в итоге, нам предоставили законченный, полноценны продукт.
Это вдвойне отрадно, ведь и мир, и персонажи, в игре - крайне любопытные. Все герои, тут - животные (мы играем за милейшего мышонка-барда по имени Тило, который пытается спасти свою жену, попутно не попав в лапы к крысам).
Видно что создатели старались преподнести историю мира игры (тут есть, своя, небольшая энциклопедия).
Хоть локаций и немного (крепость-тюрьма, да окрестные руины), заняться есть чем - мы выполняем задания других героев (как-правило, на поиск чего-либо), собираем части костюмов для Тило (7 наборов костюмов, каждый из которых влияет на наши характеристики + например, мышонок в костюме пиратcкого капитана, то еще мимими ^_^), или просто исследуем окрестности, стараясь не попадаться на глаза крысиной страже (дать сдачи мы не можем, а лишь оглушаем на время + главный герой не очень-то и живуч).
По геймплею игра - стелс, с легкой примесью rpg.
Приятная музыка и очень достойная графика, для инди-разработчиков, только дополняют великолепную атмосферу.
Крайне рекомендую купить. 
К тому же, завязка игры, явно намекает на продолжение.

40906806.review:
I love this game, The setting is great, the dialogue in incrediably well written, the gameplay is fun. I plan to do Multiple playthroughs of it. However the current state of this game is completely unacceptable for a full release. i would have much preferred for them to have taken more time in the Early Access phase to iron out more bugs and add some polish.


       Bugs stay with this game from start to finish. Holes in the geometry of the world, very easily seen. Missing sound effects in the game, the [spoiler]magpie encounter[/spoiler], elevator bells dont ring, [spoiler]Silas' whistling[/spoiler] is never heard, rope basket moving has no sound, pinecone explosions dont make any noise. There are a few animations missing from the game, the most blatant one is the missing transition from standing to climbing a ladder. The worst are the numerous game breaking bugs that halt all progress for the main quest. I personally encountered two bugs (though the steam forums suggest many more can happen) that stopped all progression requiring me to reload multiple times to figure out what order to do certian actions to get a quest to register and advance when there should be no such need. If you do certian actions too early in the game without recieveing the proper quest that quest can be forever locked out in the current playthrough.


        Ghost of a Tale is a wonderful game, I did enjoy it but it is simply unacceptable to call this a final release, I felt like I was still bug testing through the whole game. The second half felt rushed and more streamlined to just push the player to teh end instead of letting the story unfold in the rich world that the developers have created. I can't reccommend a purchase of this game no matter how great it is until it is bug free (atleast the game breaking bugs) and offers a full experience to the consumer. Its a world you can very easily be immersed in but the game just as soon rips you right back out with all its problems.

        TL:DR
--Amazing game 
--Wonderful story 
--Fantastic dialogue
--Rushed and full of minor and game breaking bugs stopping story progression
--WAIT FOR MORE PATCHES/SALE

40906334.review:
Un superbe jeu aventure-rpg dans un univers très bien construit, où les pnj ont des choses drôles et intéressantes à raconter. L’histoire ainsi que les thèmes abordés est un des points forts de Ghost of a Tale. Parfois léger ou grave c’est toujours un plaisir d’interagir avec ces personnages.

L’exploration étant un aspect très important du jeu, il dispose d’un excellent level design. Le gameplay est simple mais efficace avec des phases d’infiltrations. La musique est bien mais reste discrète. Direction artistique médiéval très belle. Inutile de parler des graphismes. C’est beau à chialer.

Dommage qu'il n y a pas de doublage et de mise en scène. Mais pour un premier jeu, je passe l'éponge.

Ghost of a Tale est donc parfait pour ceux qui veulent une belle histoire, des personnages attachants et explorer un monde qui serait issu d’un Conte.

40906101.review:
Посмотрел обзоры других людей по данной игре и решил запилить свой, так как наше понимание этой игры немного разнится. 
   Первое, что я хотел бы отметить, это так называемая "няшность" игры, все игровые журналисты и мамкины обзорщики из стима без устали "мимимизируют" игру, таким образом, на самом деле, сильно принижая ее ценность. По моему мнению, если бы разработчики вместо зверьков использовали на роль всех персонажей игры людей (эльфов, гномов, орков), то ничего бы не изменилось, эта игра очень самобытная, но не из-за своего облика, а из-за геймплея и наратива, то бишь, механики. 
  Итак, механика - люди могут закидать меня сцанными тряпками или обозвать как угодно, но мне эта игра напомнила первые две Готики, а также первый Ризен. Общая атмосфера темного фентэзи, нежелание каждого НПС вас водить за ручку и раскрытие подробностей только спустя несколько часов мучений, да даже отсутствие каких-либо маркеров и указаний... в этой игре везде чувствуется густая атмосфера рпг ранних двухтысячных. Первое, что нужно сделать, проходя эту игру, начисто убить в себе желание считать эту игру детской, как раз после этого и возникнет то самое приятное чувство приобщенности к чему-то великому, вы постепенно будете узнавать лор данного мира, историю отдельных персонажей, которая подается крохотными порциями, что только сильнее разжигает интерес для любителей квестов и рпг старой школы. 
 Подводя итог, хочу сказать, что я крайне удивлен, если не сказать, что я в восторге, игра в магазине стоит 465 рублей и по своей атмосфере выдерживает конкуренцию с играми ААА-класса, я не буду говорить глупости и сравнивать ее с кингдом кам и третьим ведьмаком, потому что сравнение будет попросту неуместным, но хочу отметить, что эта игра настоящий неограненный алмаз для любителей подобного жанра. 
 P.S. По поводу продолжительности, наиграл на момент обзора 14 часов, уже близок к концу. однако осталось немало незавершенных побочных заданий. Да! В игре за 465 рублей есть интересные побочные задания, карл!

40899489.review:
Now this is what a great indie game is! It has amazing visuals, good animations and is very well optimized despite using Unity (which is known for poor perfomance in 3D games).

To me Ghost of a Tale is like Arkham Asylum meets Dark Souls meets Hitman with cute antropomorphic mice and somewhat less cute antropomorphic rats for enemies.

As in Arkham Asylum, you go around a keep on an island and carry out a variety of tasks. As in Dark Souls, you find new equipment sets and open passageways connecting locations you already visited and creating shortcuts: level design in Ghost of a Tale is truly amazing. Finally, as in Hitman you avoid being seen or put on a disguise to move freely among your enemies.

Alas, you can see Ghost of a Tale could use a bigger budget: the game lacks voice overs, has poor sound design (some sounds are too loud, too quiet or missing at all). I believe the authors planned to have songs and voice-overs (because why would you make the hero a minstrel otherwise?), but there're no resources to implement.

But worst of all, the game has quite a few bugs. Some of those are minor (like rats sometimes not going back to sleep when you wake them), some are more severe (like quests not progressing). On top of that the camera can be quirky and default controls are somewhat unusual (thankfully, you can remap even gamepad bindings).

Anyway, even despite its flaws the game is great and is definitely a nice choice whether you look for a game to play with your family or a game you could play solo and go for hardcore achievements such as never be detected by an enemy.
