40895871.review:
Влюбился в эту игру с первой минуты. 
И игре хоть и полторы с четвертью локаций, но хочется залезть в каждый уголок. 
Персонажи отличные! И ни разу не чувствуются клише (это не сарказм!)
Выглядит игра бомбично, а главный герой лучший мыш которого я видел. Его анимации круты и милы.
Советую любому, кому нравятся сказки и хорошие истории.

А теперь  к минусам. 
К сожалению баги - бич данной игры. Нет-нет, дело не в просадке в FPS или провалов в текстуры. Данных огрехов мной не были замечены.
Баги скорее больше касаются звука. Часто пропадает эмбиент или отельных звуков (как например взрывов от шишек (да тут есть шишки-гранаты) или бесшумная сорока), но я считаю в скором времени это поправят. Частенько можно увидеть "швы" и просветы в текстурах, не смотря на всю старательность и душу вложенных в эти локации. 
Свет и тень сделаны изумительно, но если выкрутить дальность прорисовки на максимум, то можно встретить небольший лаги при переходе из одной локации в другую. Но зато нет никаких подзагрузок и дизайн уровней на высоте.
Диалоги хороши, хоть и совершенно не вариативны, но это не та игра где нужны разветвления. Не хватает, разве что, катсцен.

Разработчики, вы большие молодцы! С нетерпением жду продолжения. У этой игры, этой вселенной очень большой потенциал. Надеюсь в продолжении будут катсцены, побольше активных действий (ведь наш мыш больше не просто менестрель, хватит ему защищаться бутылками и шишками), надеюсь песни можно будет услышать в исполнении живых актеров, и голоса героев тоже. Удачи Вам, и спасибо!

40895558.review:
It's a great and fun little adventure, in a tightly built and connected area. I highly reccomend it to fans of the genre, and have personally had a wonderful time with it!

What you need to keep in mind though, is that this game is significantly more an adventure game, than any other genre, and there is no consistent gameplay loop to speak of. 

If you like this genre, and find the setting intriguing, then you're in for a great treat! 
If not, I suggest your steer clear, or at least wait for a sale.

Also, the game is, as of the writing of this review, incredibly buggy. There are almost daily patches, that fixes a lot every time, and the game is fully playable, but expect some jank.

40880736.review:
What a work of art! 

SeithCG have produced an impossibly charming world and I haven't been as mesmerised by the visual direction of a game since Trine 2. The animations are some of the best I've seen and the characters they breathe life in to are utterly adorable. I'm amazed that this was produced almost entirely by one man with assistance from a very small crew.

From a gameplay perspective, I admit that there are better stealth games out there but it is still a highly enjoyable title to play. The interconnected layout of the castle and its surroundings with cleverly placed shortcuts just oozes Dark Souls and there are plenty of "Oh, I'm back here!" moments throughout the game. 

I managed to pick the game up a bit cheaper when it was in Early Access but wouldn't have been disappointed at all if I missed that window and paid the full £20. Get it bought!

 Вы там совсем не учились сценарному мастерству? За это тебе [b]-[/b] [/spoiler]

+/- Этот твой постоянный бектрекинг и временами фрустрирующая сложность доп. квестов, порой отталкивают.

Нет правда, что в пещере, что в лесу, звук везде одинаковый - Тишина и мои шаги. И ладно, было бы это не так плохо, но вот некоторые скрипты завязаны на этих звуках, и порой это ломало квесты и диалоги, я будто играл в хардкор режиме, пытаясь понять почему квест застопорился? - Зона побережья. Нет, правда, я там часа 1.5 протоптался в первый раз, пытаясь найти выход, а еще там дико садилась производительность, то еще приключение в 9fps, я вам скажу.

[b]Звуковое исполение[/b] - 5 из 10, но только из-за багов. Пофиксят, будет где то 9 или 10.

[b]Проработка мира[/b] - 9 из 10.

[b]Техническое исполнение[/b] - 1 Бета тест из 1 Релиза. Игре бы еще годик побыть в EA, очень много дыр в текстурах, несрабатывающих скриптов, и прочих багов, это сильно сказывается на геймплее и восприятии в остальном прекрасной игры.

[h1]Закрывая глаза на баги, общая оценка игры - [b]8.7[/b][/h1]

40867971.review:
This game is labelled as an action RPG, but as is mentioned in detail, the focus is on immersion and exploration to the point that I'd call this an exploratory scavenger hunt. For the most part, it does do a good job at that while telling a solid story.

The gameplay itself revolves around finding items to advance - I'd argue that even the included stealth elements and limited combat just serve as obstacles to get to new locations to search for the items needed to progress the story. It isn't easy either, as item highlighting ranges from limited to none, and the environments have a lot of detail and care put into them that make it easy to miss what needs to be picked up.

The game demands a good bit of attention paid to it while exploring, and that works just fine, as the atmosphere and presentation of the story throughout is top notch. I can certainly say I wouldn't have enjoyed the game if it was just a raw video game collectathon. As it is, I'm giving it a thumbs up.

With that said, there are some issues that made it a weak thumbs up.

Much of the game made me feel like it wasn't quite ready to get out of early access. I didn't run into anything game breaking, but there were plenty of small janky issues between camera jittering in small nooks, regular animation hiccups, etc. Some design elements also seem questionable or underdeveloped, such as losing the ability to revisit NPC dialogue topics. Good information and hints are lost if you forget or didn't write it down yourself, save for reloading a save to before when that dialogue was chosen. Even so, these are relatively minor grievances, and the developer appears to be working on various bug fixes that will hopefully continue until there's a fine polish.

The bigger issue, and the reason why my thumbs up is weak and hesitant, was the feeling of disappointment I got from the story. Big plotpoints did not resolved satisfactorily, or even at all - in fact, it felt outright incomplete, as though there's a missing final act.

Even with its flaws, if you like atmosphere and story while exploring a game's every nook and cranny, I'd recommend giving this one a shot.

Ghost of a Tale is gorgeous.  I love the scenery, the characters, and the lore of the world.
Unfortunately, that's about where all the positives end.

I'd describe this game as a tedious scavenger hunt with some adventure elements. Most of the game is 'find the hidden item' which unlocks further area/story progression. That's fine and all, but when you add in a stealth element while you're running around the same areas for several hours sneaking passed the same guards... it gets old quick.
[b]Gameplay is boring and repetitive.[/b]

I love the music when it actually plays. I find myself walking around hearing my own footprints when suddenly instruments begin playing abruptly, usually in weird transition locations. This game seems to lack some sound design too, like several sounds seem to be implied: I'm told someone's whistling, i'm told something screeches, that thing exploded... 
 but i didn't hear a sound.  I don't know if something's broken on the game's end but it really takes me out of a scene.
[b]The sounds/music are really good when they actually play[/b]

Story. I really loved the story this game has to tell.  I love the way it was presented and how we learned about Tilo and the other important casts of characters. BUT then they [u]END[/u] the story at the end of Act II.  We're finally going to face-on the main plot, the climax of EVERYTHING but no. 
[b]THERE'S NO CONCLUSION TO THIS RELEASED GAME.[/b] 

I can look past the boring gameplay and give some leniency when faced with some technical issue, but when you just end a compelling story I'm wholeheartedly interested in with no conclusion... it just turns this [i]passable[/i] game into something I'd never recommend.

Edit 1: Had compared it to a point-n-click. Changed it to scavenger hunt to better clarify the nature of the game.

40861215.review:
Hidden gem of the year. There's an exciting trend happening in PC gaming right now where we see Indie purity of expression meeting Triple A production values. This game epitomizes that. 

Right off the bat, you can tell this is made by an ex-Dreamworks veteran. The animation and art design feel like a Pixar movie and Redwall book had an adorable baby. The graphics are spectacular (can't believe this is made in the Unity engine). The controls are fluid (played using gamepad) and intuitive, so much so, the controller often fades from thought, leaving an immersive link between yourself and the character. 

Gameplay is a relaxing, yet engaging mix of stealth (Splinter Cell as a mouse anyone?) with some thoughtful puzzles and immersive world exploration. There are no MINIMAPS and NO OBJECTIVE MARKERS, and the game is better for it. Instead of mindlessly clomping towards an objective marker, you learn to navigate and explore a beautiful world, drinking in the detail. The immersion is heightened as a result. That said, once collected, there are maps you can quickly pull up without going to a separate menu. This is the perfect combination between keeping the focus on the environment, but also giving you some handy orienteering tools.

The writing is tight, punchy, and entertaining. There is no spoken dialogue or lip syncing and I absolutely prefer it that way. When someone talks, you enter a conversation window where the words appear over time (typewriter style) mimicking the natural delivery of speech. It's surprisingly effective and combined with the colorful and concise writing (no monotonous monologues), I wouldn't opt for high quality voice overs and lip syncing even if it were an option. This is a great example of turning a constraint into a boon.

The best part of the writing is the footnote system. Rather than relegate important information to a clunky codex buried in another menu, the game makes use of footnotes. During conversation, when a word or piece of lore comes up, you can toggle a footnote to read more about it. This makes the lore come alive in an efficient and engaging way without feeling like a chore. It sure is nice for the information you're curious about to be readily available at the same time, on the same screen as the conversation it's relevant to. It seems like a simple thing, but I can't think of a single game that uses the footnote system. Groundbreaking.

Lastly, this game oozes with character. With so many run of the mill clones out there, this game is refreshingly unique and original. This game is easily worth the price of admission for its uniqueness alone. Ontop of that, I haven't experienced any bugs (playing the full release), the game performs incredibly well, and the level of polish exceeds that of many AAA games (Final Fantasy 15 to name a contemporary). It's so good, I almost feel bad only paying 25 bucks for this gem. These are the kinds of developers that deserve our support.

40860574.review: Если вы когда-то давно смотрели мультсериал Рэдволл (по книжкам Брайана Джейкса), любите иногда отдохнуть за сказочными приключениями не завязанными на кровопролитии или вы просто умиляетесь глядя на всяких антропоморфных животных, то эта игра для вас. На первый взгляд, скромный по размерам мир игры, заставляет вас провести в нём не один час, исследуя его вдоль и поперёк, выполняя поручения местных обитателей и наполняя удовлетворением от нахождения ключа к очередной двери или сундуку, содержащему необходимый по заданию предмет. Собирательство присутсвует, и оно стало тем ещё испытанием на усидчивость, т.к. я играл в версию, где присутсвовал баг с отображением собираемых предметов на карте (они просто отсутствовали). К визуальной составляющей никаких претензий, картинка радует глаз и всё выглядит законченным, без намека на халтуру. Озвучки персонажей в игре нет, все диалоги подаются вам в виде текста, сопровождаемом в углу милейшими зарисовками вашего собеседника, меняющимися в зависимости от его эмоции и типа реплики. Это больше плюс, лично для меня, как человека утомлённого тем, что сейчас в каждой второй игре, разработчики (которых видимо к ТВ не допустили, что они на игропроме отыгрываются), пичкают игрока бесконечными катсценами и болтовнёй длиною в жизнь. Из разочарований, пожалуй, концовка. Что это, ждите вторую часть? С удовольствием, да поскорее бы, а то главную сюжетную линию так и не раскрыли. Но, тем не менее, замечательная игра, несмотря на баги на старте, ну что уж тут поделать, куда без этого. НО. С какой оперативностью выходят исправления и разработчик, в случае, если из-за какой-то ошибки, вы застряли на одном из квестов, даже предлагает вам... выслать ваши файлы сохранений ему, чтобы он всё исправил! Так то...)

40858627.review:
An absolutely fantastic game, even more so considering the size of the team working on it. There's lots of things about it I'd like to critique, like how the stealth falls through pretty much entirely as soon as you get a disguise, how easy it is to escape enemies when spotted. It shows that the lead dev started game development only five years ago.

Nonetheless, all these flaws are minor when you actually play. The visuals, the designs, the story, the characters, the world, it's all so well done, so finely crafted, dripping with charm. This game is a labour of love, and you can tell.

The level design is especially notable. It's reminiscent of the original dark souls (take a shot), as you find new places, and find new shortcuts throughout. It can get labyrinthine at times, but you will often enough acquire maps that help you navigate.

Next up I'd like to commend the writing of the game, and the music that accompanies it. Throughout the game you meet a great many colourful characters, and interacting with them is a joy. Throughout conversations, they will mention lore-related topics, and you can get a quick lore snippet explaining what's being said. Read all of them. The lore draws you in, and has humor sprinkled throughout in all the right places. The pacing of the story is spot-on (I never felt like the ending just snuck up on me.)

As you play a minstrel, you will occasionally be asked by characters to play songs. If you read the songbook in your inventory, you might pick up on the fact that you'll occasionally have to play a song appropriate to the situation. Despite there being no voice acting in the game at all, the melody holds up by itself and as the lyrics accompany the song, you can just hear it play in your head. Again the writing is to be commended, as the songs range from heroic tales to shantys to satire to mockery to rude songs. Every one is a delight.

On the whole I'd say that there are some decisions in terms of gameplay I disagree with, but I will still strongly recommend it.

Jeu très relax, parfait pour décompresser. 
Ambiance superbe, une intrigue un peu lente au départ puis au fur et à mesure que l'on avance on s'interesse de plus en plus au background des "races" et de leurs coutumes.

Les points positifs :
- Décors et graphismes soignés et détaillés
-Les animations sont très organiques et naturelles
-Les musiques (trop peu présente à mon gout par moment)
-Gameplay assez relax même si par moment on peu avoir quelques coups de pression assez violent
- Bonne durée de vie pour un jeu à ce prix
-De bonne quêtes annexes qui complete bien l'histoire principales
-Personnage mignon et attachant

Les points négatifs :
- Beaucoup d'aller retour entre les differentes zones
- Collectibles inutile qui n'apportent que du lore
- IA trop permissive, on peut literralement rush à côté des gardes qui laisse tomber les recherches au bout du couloir
-Quelques bugs post-release qui seront certainement corrigés rapidement (map buggé, chute infinis à travers le décor..)


En conclusion, super ravis d'avoir fais ce jeu que je n'attendais pas forcement, j'avais peur de la durée de vie mais au final le jeu s'est cloturer au moment parfait avant la lassitude ! 
Une bonne aventure que je ne serais pas mécontent de retrouver pour une suite !

40846570.review:
Ghost of a Tale würde ich als "gemütliches Schleich-Spiel mit einem ziemlich perfektem Welt- und Charakter Design" beschreiben. 

Das Gameplay besteht zumeist aus "Hol & Bring"-Aufgaben und sich nicht von Rattenwachen erwischen zu lassen. Das ist in anderen Spielen eher langweilig, passt aber meiner Meinung nach in "Ghost of a Tale" wunderbar in das Spiel, da es im wesentlichen darum geht die schön gestaltete Landschaft zu erkunden, in der auch die eine oder andere "Abkürzung" geöffnet werden kann und manches Rätsel gelöst werden muss. Ghost of a Tale ist ein Spiel "Aus einem Guß" in dem alles prima zusammenpasst und ist somit empfehlenswert wie ich finde.

40844604.review:
I really love that game. It has this fairytale adventure vibe that is incredible executed. The Graphics of this game are beautiful in my eyes and the world has a Dark Souls 1 connection style it is really great.

The most weakness is that the AI of the enemies are sometimes really disappointing. Sometimes you always hide in the same and only basket that is around in an area and the guards not even on the third time hiding there try to catch you. It would make a really really better game if guards would safely figure out where you are after some time so that they get you, you take dmg and then run to the next hideout.

But the Sound Design is awesome, the character design is awesome, it has very cool dialogues and very lovely drawn character heads with emotions in those dialogues. 

If you want to have a slow game with dangerous exploring you are in the right place.


------>>>> After Playthrough <<<<<------

I must say. If I could give this game double thumbs up I would do because this story is incredibly well designed. It is so cute, it is funny, it is riddly, it is unexpected and also expected. Dark Souls Level design, cool costume features. The Lore behind this World has something charming and is really embracing the flair of a Fairy Tale. Incredible that only so few people worked on that game. That makes it even more brilliant.

40843073.review:
①首先，小老鼠真的好可爱好可爱好可爱呀！（重要的事情说三遍）

②游戏是有中文的，进去之后在Options→Gameplay→Language处可以选择Chinese，但在现阶段中文显示乱码，只能等之后的补丁修正了，等不及的可以先就着英文玩（虽然词汇不难，但是文本量还是蛮惊人的）。

③游戏优化很棒，中午在A站看了孙尚香的推荐在公司里直接买了下载玩，i5+GTX660+8G内存的电脑玩起来画面品质依旧很丰满、帧数很足。美术风格可以参见商城截图，人物建模很细致，交互界面非常简洁，操作起来也很简单，基本就是潜行跑步以及躲藏，战斗要素没有（可能是因为主角是个职业为吟游诗人的弱鸡，也可能是我还没碰到）；有解密元素。

④这游戏没有小地图，在获得图纸之后能看到的也没有大地图，而且场景里小道很多，每一关怎么走的都要记住，这样游戏不容易腻，但是估计会对一些对方向不敏感的玩家造成一些门槛，而且因为地图细节很丰富，我玩的时候总是生怕自己会遗漏什么东西，所以常常一遍两遍的跑同一个地方也不觉得枯燥。

④游戏可互动收集的东西非常多，主角醒来之后环顾四周，可以看到地上有个苹果核、面包，罐子里有钱和纸条、墙上有蘑菇，花的话床上有一朵，窗台上也有一朵，先吃东西把左上角的血条填满，血条越长跑得越远。地上的小虫子跑来跑去好像是个摆设，但其实是可以捉的，而且小虫子蛋白质丰富，鸡肉味，嘎嘣脆，是居家旅行、益气补血的良品。

⑤这款游戏从画面、音乐、音效、建模、优化、关卡设计上，很难相信这是一款由小团体制作的独立游戏，听说制作人因为这款游戏变得囊中羞涩，有兴趣的，不妨支持一哈？

最后吐槽一下游戏名字，和游戏内容有半毛钱关系。

潜行类游戏爱好者推荐√
剧情解密类游戏爱好者推荐√
RPG游戏爱好者推荐√
换装游戏爱好者推荐√（是的，这个游戏你甚至可以换装！我才玩了短短几十分钟就收集了3个套装，每一套都各具萌点）

40835684.review:
My word~! I've been smitten by this game.

To keep it quick, as there are professional reviewers to give you the fine details, here are some bullets to why I recommend snagging this title:
[list]
[*]The stealth is not really in-depth. Kind of a "baby's first stealth". It is definitely a passable system, just dont expect anything to scratch that "stealth" itch too hard.
[*]The charcters are interesting and cute as dang.
[*]The disguise system makes for a ton of fun.
[*]Theres a lot of open exploration and getting to know the map. Youll find a key to a door you couldnt open in the first 10 minutes half way through the game. This makes the map more memorable as you run around faster and faster as you get to know it better.
[*]Ive run into a few situations where I had to think critically to figure out what my next steps were, which I really enjoyed.
[/list]

Those are just the points I could think of off the top of my head. I implore you check this game out, and support its creators. I look forward to 100% this game.

40834864.review:
An impressive adventure game in which relies on stealth gameplay and excellent exploration, with fantastic art style and visual presentation. Extremely hard to believe that the game was created with a very small team and it just oozes with labor of love.

You control a tiny little mouse in third person perspective, avoiding fights and sneaking around enemies, generally by finding clues when interacting with the world to get around the situations; all of this in an interconnected world in which to squeak around.

It’s a call back to the stealth genre like Thief, with recent reminder of interconnected levels like Dark souls.

Strongly recommend for anyone who is into stealth genre or likes to control a cute little mouse through an oppressive world.

The gameplay is no slouch either. Imagine Thief but you’re a mouse, lots of stealth and avoiding enemies. 

Get this game and support an indie dev who poured his heart and soul into a beautiful game.

40832441.review:
Ghost of a tale is beyond a stunning game. I got this game from a friend back in 2016 during early access (Since it was on my wishlist), i played only a little of it back then because it was unfinished and i told myself i'd get more into it when the game offically came out. The little i did play of it back then i knew i was going to love it so much. The Graphics and attention to detail caught me by surprise. It's possibly one of the cutest games i've ever got my hands on. I loved the fact it was a sneaking game too. I had no idea at the time i got this game what type of game this was, I only knew that you play as a mouse and i wanted it haha. I was not let down at all. But let it be known it's not exactly an easy game either. There's alot of puzzles, exploring and examing little things around you. I've managed to get lost quite abit but once you figure out what u have to do it's awesome. The dialogues in the game are pretty humorous as well. I've caught myself laughing alot at the things the NPCs say. It truly makes me smile. ☺

My ONLY issue with this game is the fact that it can be too cute at times (I'm jk-ing about it being an issue btw). Often i'll catch myself just staring at my character (Tilo) and admiring the adorable little outfits you can wear and the beautiful scenery around him. 

Now that the game is fully released i can safely say this game is worth every penny. If you like cute things and you like stealth games this is SO for you. Currently there are quite a bit of bugs though, so i will say that. But i like the game too much to even care. So there's that. 

Side note: Playing this make's me feel bad whenever i hop on Wahammer: Vermintide 2 and murder rats (even tho they are evil too in this game) haha. 

10/10 I only wish i knew about this game back in it's early early development so i could of been a backer as well. Would've been worth every penny. Thank you SeithCG for creating this wonderful wonderful gem of a game.

40825330.review:
A really great and fun game to play, but has a multitude of bugs and issues.

Map's have a tendency to swap to the correct one for the area, making traversing through some of the areas to be rather frustrating. One of the map in particular (Catacombs) is completely broken and displays your location as being the opposite of where you actually are, which also causes the markers on the map to not be visible. Several times in the game I have had to ask the question "Has this quest broken, or do I need to find something else to do to continue" Early on in my playtime I encountered one game breaking bug that required me to reload an earlier save and now recently I have run into another one that requires the same

I do think this game is very enjoyable but I'd say give it a month or so and then pick it up. You'll have a much better time and hopefully wont run into game-breaking bugs.



UPDATE : 

Literally within the hour of posting this review the developer fixed the game breaking bug with the latest update. The developers are working super fast on the games issues and ironing them out. So I am going to change this to a recommends

40820970.review:
Пока мышиная история была в раннем доступе, я попробовала поиграть, но не сложилось: игра очень тормозила, а когда наступала ночь, было абсолютно ничего не видно за пределами узкого круга света от фонаря, а стражники меня видели прекрасно. Решила дождаться релиза и вот, дождалась – игра по-прежнему не понравилась, но теперь уже чисто геймплеем.
Плюсы проекта – это атмосфера, очаровательные персонажи, сказочная симпатичная графика, анимация мышонка, хорошее звуковое оформление. Озвучки, правда, нет, что тоже минус. Но главное – проходить ее быстро становится скучно. 
Стелз тут сводится к ползанию на цыпочках со скоростью задумчивой улитки и сидению в сундуках и бочках по десять минут, хитрить и искать разные пути не придется. В принципе задача игрока – исследовать локацию, искать предметы, выполнять квесты типа «принеси то не знаю что». Если велят идти в сторожевую башню, не то что на карте ее не отметят, даже рукой в ее сторону не махнут. Если нужно найти стражника, охраняющего стену, он никак не подсвечивается, сам догадайся, какую стену охраняет (а вокруг одни стены). Повсюду лежат важные неповторимые квестовые предметы, и они тоже никак не подсвечиваются. При этом бывает, что курсор наводишь точно на предмет, а действия нет – надо отойти/подойти/зайти под другим углом. И весь этот праздник среди орды надоедливых стражников, которые подмечают каждый шорох.
А что может противопоставить им наш герой? Лазать он толком не умеет, прыгает невысоко. Бегать может всего пару секунд подряд, после чего переходит на неторопливую трусцу. Тихо подкрасться и снять с пояса стражника нужную вещь, вроде бы, можно, но при изрядном везении, он тебя может услышать, а может в упор не заметить.  Можно кидаться всякой ерундой, чтобы отвлечь врагов или ненадолго вырубить, но запас таких предметов сильно ограничен.
Игра поначалу казалось сложной, потом поняла – да нет, абсолютно проходима и не вызывает проблем. Нудно прост. Либо крадешься, то и дело останавливаясь, и пытаешься разобрать в пестром графоне, где стража и где что-то полезное лежит. Либо забиваешь болт и бежишь напролом в поисках ближайшего подходящего сундука, который стража еще не видит. Постоянно надо возвращаться в уже знакомые места, снова обманывать тех же стражников, снова красться по тем же коридорам. За несколько часов это надоело до зевоты, возвращаться к прохождению вообще нет желания. Еще и баги остались даже после долгого пребывания игры в раннем доступе, в ранних обзорах про них писали. 
5/10 за красоту. В принципе, проект симпатичный и самобытный. И все же, как мне кажется, шквал положительных оценок и заверений, что игра заткнет за пояс ААА проекты, не адекватен реальному качеству игры.

" I gave you my word as a pirate, but I suppose I can make an exception!"

I bought this game awhile back when it was only $15 and was unfinished. I've been waiting for months for it to be fully released, and I was so excited to see it was released on the PC! I played about 2.5 hrs and can say this game is really alluring and enthralling so far. It looks beautiful, there is humor in it, and it is still challenging. There is a "cute" aspect (after all you're a cute little mouse!), but the game is still "adult" enough and I don't feel like I'm playing a "kids" game by any means.

The story makes me want to keep playing to see what happens next. It is not an action game where you kill stuff, so you'll need to use your brains and outsmart enemies. I currently am playing Styx: Shards of Darkness (another stealthy game) but am dropping that to play this till I finish because this game is one of a few I specifically have been waiting for release (others include Praey for the Gods, Darksiders 3, Metro Exodus, and Far Cry 5). I'll update this review as I progress.

If $25 is a bit much then I suggest putting it on your wishlist until sales come around (e.g., summer sale), keep playing what you have for a little bit and cop this on a sale promo.

40814611.review:
There are major spoilers for the main plot of the story ahead. Please read at your own discretion.

--

This game was like love at first sight for me. When I first played the Early Access back in the summer of 2017, I was instantly encapsulated by the wondrous scenery and breathtaking attention to detail. Every character felt distinct, with their own cute quirks and amusing dialogue, but not without some sense of dramatic gravitas every once in a while. The missions, both the main story missions and side missions, were fun to play through, and the story developed in such a gripping and natural manner that I could not help but keep playing to see what would happen next. And all of this is still true for the game.
For the first 6 hours.
Once you clear the catacombs, it becomes painfully obvious the rest of the game was rushed in order to make a viable release. The game starts to become more focused, more narrow, which is odd considering how open-feeling the first half of the game was. Certain quests that were immediately accessible in the Early Access version are now delayed later on into the story in order to give the player 'something' to do as a distraction. This is because, if the player buckles down and focuses on completing the side missions as soon as they get them, they will find that the story can be played through fairly quickly. Granted, I have already played through the first half of this game in Early Access, but because of how much has changed for the release version, I would argue my completion time of only 10 hours (not counting the six I played in Early Access) is probably going to be the average, give or take depending on how much they take their time or rush through. Note, that I did not complete all the side objectives, and there are certain challenge runs (don't eat anything, don't get caught, etc.) that will certainly lengthen the playtime of potential fanatics to possibly 20+ hours.
But the reason I can't recommend this, is because of two reasons.
1. The game is quite buggy for a "final" release, and is frankly inexcuseable at this point.
2. The game is outright not finished.
The first part is easy to explain, right? There are many issues with platforming, sound, and even dialogue in some cases, as well as the occasional save issue. At one point there was one particularly nasty sequence break I ACCIDENTALLY preformed, in which I skipped the Catacombs segment ENTIRELY. However, because of how linear the game's progression is, I still had to go back and complete the section in order to advance the main story.
The second part, on the other hand, is far more personal, and just outright insulting. As I mentioned earlier, it becomes clear in the second part of the game that much of the content feels rushed in order to reach the release date, however it gets even WORSE in the third part, near the end. Sections at this point lose any sense of polish, and start to feel like something you should see in an Early Access title, not a fully fledged release. There are no sounds for monsters, no new music, no new side missions, you are railroaded to completing the main story at this point, and while the story is still certainly gripping, I cannot imagine it holding the attention of the average gamer long enough for them to finish the game.
[SPOILERS]
But the worst part is the ending itself. After finally figuring out where Merra, the protaganists' wife and MacGuffin, is, you unearth a pirate treasure on the shore which is revealed to house a crystal of the Green Flame, an apocalyptic force which arguably set in motion the events for both the lore and plot of the game. After defeating the crystal (with the help of your friends), you learn that the crystal is only a representation of the Green Flame's power, and the Green Flame itself is still housed at Periclave, the same island where Merra is supposedly trapped. It all lines up perfectly, and after tying up all the loose ends, you sail away in the rowboat to Periclave, and....
The credits roll.
That's it. You wanted closure? Too bad, have a credits screen.
This game is just objectively not finished. There is NO reason for Periclave to not be the final section of this game. Like, imagine if a movie ended this way. People would be PISSED, and rightfully so. This type of cliffhanger ending is just not condusive to good storytelling, because it is in no way satisfying or even worthy of being called a "final" ending for the game.
I love this game, I really do, and I imagine I will certainly come back to it after a few weeks to go over the game and get 100 percent, complete all the achievements and challenge runs, and maybe even speedrun it. But, for the average consumer, I cannot recommend this. In the future, if Periclave is added and the final parts of the game polished up, then I will certainly recommend this.
But, seeing as this is a "full" release, I doubt that will happen anytime soon.

This is a example of a game made with real love, As a mouse minstrel you will have to sneak around finding your away around the amazing looking world. You pick up food items to survive as you go along your journey, while using whatever you can find to jump into for cover, It just looks so cute when you jump into buckets or chests! Also there's things to use, like bottles to throw, or my fave throwing out some goo and watching them slip over, The stealth aspect of the game is done really well, the placement of things to hide in around the levels are well thought out and the puzzle aspect will have you searching around for quest items or finding ways to unlock things and are also very well paced and never feel like a grind.

A super cute game made with real love and it shows, Looks great and plays well, after all the Indie spam on steam, its refreshing to see something this well done, Great for all ages this is one everyone should own!

To tell the truth, I first bought this game out of early access when I saw the main character Tilo; I admit, I'm a sucker for cute things! However, the more I got into the game, the more I fell in love with the story and the motivations of Tilo, the perilous dangers presented by the enemies in the game, the steath gameplay, and definitely the visuals and graphics. 

And this is all when this game was still blooming during 2016-2017! The game is so much better now, from a visual and technical standpoint then it was when I first delved into the game. This is especially true when the developer was still ironing out kinks in gameplay style and bugs, and now it is certainly a lot more playable.

I can definitely recommend this game as of the time of this review, especially if you are a fan of stealth based sneaker games, and I certainly hope that you join Tilo in his adventures sneak past rats and save his lover!

40793088.review:
I knew about it from an article, and I was instantly hooked. I played this little gem very early into Early Access. Despite being in a very early stage of development, it oozed charm and mistery, and was amazingly colored, lighted, well crafted and animated for a first attempt in a not so well suited at the time Unity engine. It had some rough edges, sure, but not many and I already knew that I was gonna love it once it released, so I stopped playin till the release date came, happy about helping the developer with my dolans to take this already faceted gem and polish it.

It tickled all the right boxes: a fable inspired by those amazing western dark animation masterpieces of the 70s and 80s like The Secret of NIMH, An American Tail, The Black Cauldron, Wizards, Flight of The Dragons, The Last Unicorn, Dark Crystal, etc. Being born and raised in the early 80s, I watched all of those and loved the dark, creepy and misterious athmosphere animation had much more than the colorful 90s or the braindead 00s.

A heir to those is born. All hail the child of love of SeithCG and the 80s, Ghost of a Tale!!! \o/

40792847.review:
正式版出了，游戏主菜单可以有了中文选择，但是问题选择中文以后，重启游戏反而是乱码了。希望解决一下这个问题。

-------------------------------------------
由于游戏非常的出色，补充一下评测，自转A9VG论坛

最终版发售以后就开始抱着试一试的心情在玩，结果慢慢发现这游戏是披着卖萌外衣的硬核动作解密游戏。呆萌的主角的对手是红眼大老鼠，除了隐藏起来就是快速逃跑，快速跑动会像魂系列那样消耗体力槽，而游戏的体力槽跟HP又是共同的（体力槽恢复可以靠这种食物），所以，这游戏的难度算是比较大的。因为除了跟你可以交谈的npc，其余个个都是可以捏死主角的对手。游戏也提供了很多不同的装备，不同的装备对主角的参数影响很大，包括盔甲和布衣都有（有些npc必须穿正确的装备才能激活对话）。
为什么说玩这款游戏像魂系列的感受？
一、游戏难度比较大，需要玩家步步为营，存档机制靠躲在宝箱和睡觉以及npc对话方式存档，并不是随时可以存档。
二、解密方面比较有趣，可以说很硬核的解密，跟90年代pc上面的解密游戏很类似，各种对话，然后找道具拿钥匙，激活下一个区域，所以英文量还是比较大，另外中文会近期更新。
三、场景设计是真的让人眼前一亮。游戏开始主角是在一个又小又破的监狱里面，游戏几个小时以后，发现逃出了监狱以后不仅有城堡还有一个很大的后院；再游戏几个小时以后发现后院隐藏的小道出去还有偌大的海岛和一艘有故事的海盗船；然后继续游玩下去，发现还有非常大的地下城，说实话看到地下城的时候觉得就像魂一当初那种感受。
游戏里面主角的攻击方式非常的少，且需要消耗掉道具，如果提供武器攻击的话，真的就是黑魂的感觉了。另外，这款游戏的画面也可以说是很精致。

昨日通关了，后期确实赶工痕迹较重，文字量也较大，一些解密比较麻烦。如果有卡关什么的问题，欢迎咨询本人，看到了即刻解答

40791517.review: I bought the game in Early Access for the cute character design and stayed for the non-violent stealth game play :) Exploring all the corners of the castle, discovering its inhabitants is a lot of fun, and messing with the Rat Guards never gets old. Don't expect a large game or big dungeons full of enemies. The castle isn't very big, but every corner is beautifully crafted, and you really need to explore it in order to have a backup plan if things go wrong and you quickly need a place to hide. All in all, very recommended!

40752512.review:
Excellent graphics, character design, level design and so damn CUTE. The stealth mechanics are enjoyable, the many gearing/fashion options are also a lot of fun (does this pirate baldric go with my highwayman hat?) Story and writing are excellent.

Good intuitive controls on a controller (a bonus for a stealth game) and some little physics puzzles to keep things interesting.

Adventure gamers, stealth gamers and fans of Redwall/Nimh/etc should be picking this up.

Environmental sounds are solid. Nice lighting effects.

Would benefit from a stable of skilled voice actors but would also have probably cost considerably more.

9/10

Tras leer un poco sobre él y conocer de donde ha surgido, y quién lo está desarrollando, decidí comprar el acceso anticipado para apoyar su desarrollo. Ich bin kein Mensch, der wirklich gern Early Acces Spiele kauft. Es kommt vor, aber selten und immer mit einem gewissen Vorbehalt. Und um ehrlich zu sein, dieses Spiel war ein Spontan-/Affektkauf. Reviews sahen gut aus, ich war wenig informiert und habe auch nicht zu viel erwartet.

40491862.review:
Well, a game I bought with low expectations to be honest, however, it blew my mind during the first hour of gameplay. If you don't want to read any more and want a tl;dr:, well, if you enjoy old school exploration, adventure games just go ahead and buy it. Now for the wall of text.

Before reading the review, let me tell you that I have learned this game will be released in two weeks so I decided not to play any more until it is released. So I have only 1.6 hours spent on the game as I am writing this review.

First of all, setting and gameworld is really cute and stylistic. The feeling of being immersed in a fantasy world is there. The way the environment and characters are created is just a mixture of realism and fantasy. Actually, when I first started I thought it was going to take place in dungeons, but nope, it actually has a big enough world to explore. That surprised me a lot. I don't even know if there are other places as well.

Now, most games have collectibles just to keep players in the game with no real value, like trinkets and stuff which add nothing to the game once found. However, this game does an amazing job with collectibles. Everything you collect actually serves something or adds to the depth of the game. Books add to the lore, costumes add to the character stats, foods and items can be used for various purposes and even mini-quests (not side-quests mind you) are fun to do and serve a purpose to further establish the lore. I actually solely explored the area during the two hours I played because I was so immersed in the game world that I totally forgot about the mission. Another great job there.

Another positive part of the game is that writing is good as well. Some jokes really made me giggle and characters are properly-built. No character so far made me think "hmmm why the heck should I care about this character?". They feel like a natural part of the game world. Collectibles that add to the lore are well written as well, there are just so much detail that if you like reading, you will have a fun time in this game.

One more thing I enjoyed is how well the game world is built. So many hidden areas, passages, things to discover etc. makes it actually fun to traverse the map. It is not dull by any means. Actually, it is so cleverly built that even backtracking isn't an issue for me and believe me, I don't like backtracking at all. 

The only thing I don't like is that performance is a bit wonky. I honestly would not expect such a game to have performance issues. Ambient Occlusion completely obliterates performance for me and with it closed, I can play with around 45-60 fps, however, at some areas or while looking at certain objects, fps dips down to 20-30 so it is not really a stable experience. Anyway, it doesn't really hurt as it is not a competitive multiplayer game or anything, you can simply ignore.

Long story short, a brilliant game in a time where not many well made games exist. I will wait until the full release before playing any further. Well done to the developers, I genuinely enjoyed this brilliant game.

40481609.review: This game is absolutely gorgeous and I'd say the pinnacle of how early access should be handled and what an indie developer can truly do.  Simply stunning visuals both in terms of graphical fidelity and artistic direction.  Everything in terms of presentation is jaw dropping.  Gameplay is mostly stealth based and far from unique, but it is done very well and fairly forgiving for those who get frustrated with typical stealth games where getting seen will require a checkpoint restart.  while this isn't "realistic" I need to point out that you're a mouse, so just let suspension of disbelief take over and enjoy the game, mmkay?  I can not WAIT for this to reach full release and I can't wait to see what else is in store for this developer.

40228098.review: Fully recommended. This game is a wonderful fanasty style rpg, and although it isn't finished it sure is a lot of fun and satisfying even in it's half form. The world is rich with attention to detail, and every area feels like it should. The dungeons are dark and gloomy, with only warm candle light to guide your path. The outside world is vibrant during the day, very fanciful and mystical, whilst at night it's just as you expect hard to navigate and hoping you don't walk into a guard. Overall, this early access game provides you with a world you can tell the developers actually took time to craft and enjoyed creating, it might not last as long as a full length game right now, but it didn't have to at this moment for me to enjoy it thoroughly and become very pumped for the final product. I've completed the story side of thing so far, but I've only completed half the quests, and although I thought I'd gone through the game quite thoroughly, there's clearly so much more to find! I love that aspect and I can tell this game will be a gem.

39661027.review: Eh bien maintenant , après l'avoir fini ,même s'il y'aura une suite lorsque le jeu sortira définitivement, je peux dire que je l'ai aimé du début à la fin, c'est un chef d'oeuvre... une véritable perle dans le milieux du jeux indépendant , en plus de ses graphismes à en couper le souffle, le scénario est passionnant, touchant, avec une pointe d'humour vraiment appréciable , j'ai ri plus d'une fois des répliques que l'ont pouvait dire, et des dialogues avec "Kerold", des deux soi-disant grands voleurs issus d'une guilde pleine d'adeptes ! (Ceux qui y ont joué verront de quoi je parle), "Gusto" et "Fatale" sont deux personnages haut en couleurs, mais maintenant je n'en dis pas plus, je laisse le soin à ceux ou celles qui souhaitent en savoir plus en y jouant. Les tenues à collectionner sont magnifiques (les détails sont incroyablement précis) et apportent à notre protagoniste beaucoup de charme et d'amélioration, que ce soit de la discrétion comme de l'endurance ou de la ténacité , certaines de ces tenues jouent un rôle très important dans quelques situations plutôt cruciales. L'environnement possède une variété de détails impressionnants, car il m'est déja arrivé d'être passé à coté de certains collectibles (manuscrit posé sur une table en hauteur, bouteille rangée dans un coin ect...) sans m'en rendre compte, car il était si bien fondu dans l'environnement qu'il sont passé inaperçu. Le fait d'incarner une souris, dans un univers peuplé de rat pour retrouver sa bien aimée, est une idée très original.  N'hésiter plus, prenez le, si vous êtes tenté de l'acheter, car il en vaut vraiment le coup ! (le seul problème étant l'anglais pour certains, cela ne m'a pas  empêcher de comprendre l'histoire, car je maîtrise cette langue pour ce qui est de traduire les textes).
